0.title: MPs can't avoid summons when House is in session: RS Chairman Naidu
0.article_body: Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu said Members of Parliament (MPs) can't avoid summons by law enforcement agencies in criminal cases "when the session is on or otherwise". "As law-abiding citizens...it's our duty to respect the law and legal procedure," Naidu said. This comes a day after ED summoned Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge during Rajya Sabha session.

1.title: Mahindra & Mahindra Q1 net profit jumps 67% to ₹1,430 crore
1.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) on Friday reported a 67% surge in net profit to ₹1,430.2 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹857 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations rose to ₹19,612.6 crore compared to ₹11,764.82 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. The shares of M&M ended 2% lower at ₹1,236.2 at the BSE.

2.title: Fortunate to have backing but it's survival of fittest: Naga on nepotism
2.article_body: While talking about nepotism, actor Naga Chaitanya said he is fortunate to have backing but it is survival of fittest. "If my film releases and parallelly Mr. X or Y's film releases...and they are not from film family...and his or her film collects 100 crore...and mine collects 10...first phone call of producers and directors [will] go to them," he added.

3.title: Dividing cinema into regions not fair, it belongs to everyone: Manoj
3.article_body: Speaking about the north-south cinema debate, actor Manoj Bajpayee stated that dividing cinema into regions is not fair, adding that cinema belongs to everyone. The actor further said, "For me, India is from Kashmir to Kanyakumari and not from Kashmir to Delhi...If Telugu films do well, I will be just as proud as when a Hindi film does well."

4.title: I get gaalis in DMs and comments for playing a vamp: Riya Bhattacharje
4.article_body: Actress Riya Bhattacharje, who portrays Akriti Saxena on television show 'Kabhi Kabhie Ittefaq Sey', has revealed that she received hate comments and DMs for portraying a negative role. "I get gaalis...There are comments like, 'Tu marr kyun nahi jaati (Why don't you die)?" the actress added. Riya said that it bothered her initially but now she just blocks the trolls.

5.title: MP govt orders probe into land allotted to National Herald in Bhopal
5.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has ordered a probe into the land allotted to the National Herald newspaper in Bhopal. "I have issued an order to form an inquiry committee to probe...in Press Complex...where commercial buildings have come up by violating the rules," State Minister Bhupendra Singh said. "If any irregularities are found, we will...seal it off," Singh added.

6.title: 28-yr-old man arrested for molesting woman at Thane railway station
6.article_body: A 28-year-old man, Prateek Prakash Gurav, was arrested for allegedly molesting a 34-year-old woman commuter at Thane railway station, an official said on Thursday. "He was pinned down by others on the platform after the woman raised an alarm," Thane railway police official said. Gurav has been charged under IPC section 354 (assaults or uses criminal force to any woman).

7.title: Balenciaga sells pouch 'inspired by garbage bag' for ₹1.4 lakh, Twitter users react
7.article_body: Luxury fashion brand Balenciaga has unveiled its 'Trash Pouch', a $1,790 (around ₹1.4 lakh) bag "inspired by a garbage bag". Pictures of the bag made from calfskin leather have gone viral. "Thank you Balenciaga for making rich people carry out their trash bags," said a Twitter user. "It's the end of the world as we know it," said another.

8.title: It's an honour: Ranveer Singh on hosting 2022 Filmfare Awards
8.article_body: Speaking about hosting the 2022 Filmfare Awards, actor Ranveer Singh said it's an honour to be a part of "the celebration of excellence in Hindi cinema in this grand manner". He added that he used to read Filmfare magazine from cover to cover during his childhood. "I used to also take cut-outs from the magazines and save them," Ranveer said.

9.title: BJP will change the Tiranga, bring in saffron flag: Mehbooba Mufti
9.article_body: PDP chief and former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Friday criticised the BJP and and said the party will change the tricolour to a saffron flag. "In time to come, BJP will finish off even the Constitution and the foundations of secularism on which this country stands," Mufti said. "They'll make this a religious country," she added.

10.title: Man slips on rock, falls into waterfall while posing for pics in TN
10.article_body: A man in his 20s slipped on a rock and fell into a waterfall while posing for pictures in Pullaveli in Tamil Nadu's Kodaikanal. A video of the incident, which was captured by the man's friend who was reportedly taking the pictures, has surfaced online. The police and fire department have launched a search for the man following the incident.

11.title: Bribery has become routine in K'taka: HC while rejecting IAS officer's bail
11.article_body: Karnataka High Court, while rejecting IAS officer J Manjunath's bail application, said that bribery has become routine in government offices in the state. Manjunath was arrested on July 4 in a case involving a ₹5-lakh bribe by the Anti-Corruption Bureau. "Without bribes, no files will move in the usual course. Getting bribes has become a rule...it's like cancer," HC stated.

12.title: China ending cooperation with US on multiple issues after Pelosi's Taiwan visit
12.article_body: China has said it is ending cooperation with US on multiple issues after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. It has halted dialogue with US on climate change, military issues and anti-drug work in retaliation to the visit. China has also sanctioned Pelosi and her immediate family members over the Taiwan visit.

13.title: Lady Gaga confirms she will star in Joaquin Phoenix's Joker 2
13.article_body: Actress-singer Lady Gaga has confirmed that she will be featuring alongside actor Joaquin Phoenix in 'Joker: Folie a Deux'. The film will be a sequel to the 2019 film 'Joker' which won Joaquin an Oscar for Best Actor. Details about Gaga's role have not been announced yet but as per reports, she will portray Harley Quinn in the upcoming film.

14.title: Some Japanese offices temporarily shut as COVID-19 cases surge
14.article_body: As COVID-19 cases surge in Japan, some companies such as Toyota Motor and Daihatsu Motor have halted production line shifts. Others, such as KFC Holdings Japan, have shut some restaurants, while Japan Post Holdings has shut more than 200 mailing centres temporarily. Japan reported over 1.4 million new COVID-19 cases over the past week, the WHO data showed.

15.title: Body of 20-yr-old man, who was murdered, found floating in Thane lake
15.article_body: The body of a 20-year-old man, who was allegedly murdered, was found floating in a lake in Ambernath town of Thane, police said on Friday. The deceased has been identified as Vishal Sarvajit Rajbhar. His body was stuffed in a gunny sack with stone-filled bags tied to his legs and neck, police added. A case of murder has been registered.

16.title: Plan travel on I-day weekend with time: B'luru Airport on passenger surge
16.article_body: The Bengaluru Airport authorities took to Twitter to say that passengers travelling to the city should plan their travel with sufficient time as a surge in passenger volumes is expected on the Independence Day long weekend. A link to monitor queue wait times was also shared by the authorities on Twitter.

17.title: SC to hear plea to declare 'Ram Setu' a national heritage monument
17.article_body: The Supreme Court has decided to hear BJP leader Subramanian Swamy's petition to get the 'Ram Setu' designated as a national heritage monument. A three-judge bench was to hear the matter on July 26, however, it could not do so as one of the judges had some health issues. Swamy had mentioned the case for urgent listing on July 13.

18.title: China's military drills around Taiwan are significant escalation: US
18.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Friday said that China's military exercises around Taiwan, including missiles fired into Japan's exclusive economic zone, represent a "significant escalation". China launched the military drills following a visit by US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to Taiwan. Pelosi's visit was peaceful and did not represent a change in US policy toward Taiwan, Blinken added.

19.title: Sensex jumps 89 points, Nifty settles near 17,400 after repo rate hiked by 50 bps
19.article_body: The benchmark indices ended on a higher note on Friday after the RBI raised the repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40%, the highest since 2019. While BSE Sensex gained 89 points to settle at 58,387.93, Nifty ended near 17,400. Among the losers, shares of Mahindra & Mahindra were down by 2%, followed by Reliance Industries and Maruti Suzuki India.

20.title: African national arrested, cocaine worth ₹24 lakh seized in Thane
20.article_body: The Thane Crime Branch on Wednesday arrested an African national from Thane's Wagle Estate area for allegedly carrying cocaine worth ₹24 lakh. The operation was carried out by Unit-V Senior Inspector Vikas Ghodke and his team. "We found 60 grams of cocaine...We've registered a case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act," Vikas Ghodke said.

21.title: China summons Japanese, EU diplomats over statements on Taiwan
21.article_body: China said it has summoned the Japanese ambassador and European diplomats in the country to protest statements issued by the Group of Seven (G7) nations and the European Union criticising Chinese military exercises around Taiwan. Vice Foreign Minister Deng Li called the statements "erroneous" and objected to "wanton interference in China's internal affairs", the Chinese Foreign Ministry said.

22.title: All fever patients have recovered since COVID outbreak, says N Korea
22.article_body: North Korea on Friday said that all of its fever patients have recovered, marking the end of its first outbreak of coronavirus. The "anti-epidemic situation...has entered a definite phase of stability", state media said. North Korea would "redouble efforts to maintain perfection in the execution of state anti-epidemic policies", it added.

23.title: ED names Avinash Bhosale's son in Pune land grab case charge-sheet
23.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) filed a charge-sheet against Pune builder Avinash Bhosale's son, Amit Bhosale, in connection with a land grab case. ARA Properties and two others were also named in the charge-sheet. It was alleged that the land was transferred to ARA Properties, violating allotment rules. Bhosale and his son were accused of developing a commercial building on the land.

24.title: Man aiming at lizard mistakenly shoots 8-yr-old boy with air gun in Hyd
24.article_body: A 32-year-old man named Abdul Afsar has been booked for allegedly shooting an eight-year-old boy in Moghalpura, Hyderabad. Police said Afsar was shooting pellets at a dog when the victim, Azaan, asked him to aim at a lizard. Afsar tried shooting the lizard but the pellet hit the wall and got redirected towards Azaan and hit him, police added.

25.title: Car dangles from 25-foot-high wall after crash in Hyd, video emerges
25.article_body: A car was seen dangling from a 25 feet high wall at Raj Bhavan Road in Hyderabad on Wednesday evening. As per reports, the car crashed into the railing wall of a building after the brakes failed. Locals reportedly helped the driver get out of the car following the crash. The vehicle was lifted to safety using a crane.

26.title: Canadian hockey player Balraj grabs neck of opponent during CWG match, video goes viral
26.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Canadian hockey player Balraj Panesar grabbing the neck of English player Chris Griffiths during their CWG 2022 match. The fight erupted after Griffiths pulled on Panesar's stick after which Panesar grabbed his neck and tried to push him to the ground. Panesar was shown a red card.

27.title: CCTV clip shows woman throwing 4-yr-old daughter from 4th floor in B'luru, girl dies
27.article_body: A CCTV video has shown a woman throwing her four-year-old daughter from the fourth floor of a building in Bengaluru, killing the child. The video shows the accused woman climbing the railings after throwing her daughter but her family pulled her back. Police said the woman, who's a dentist, was depressed as her daughter was unable to hear or talk.

28.title: Dhamki-jeevi has intensified toxic politics of vendetta: Jairam
28.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has criticised the BJP government for allegedly doing "vendetta" politics. "Ever since Congress President (Sonia Gandhi) announced Kanyakumari to Kashmir Bharat Jodo Yatra almost 3 months back, Dhamki-jeevi has intensified his toxic politics of vendetta," Jairam tweeted. The ED had recently questioned Congress leaders, Sonia and Rahul Gandhi over the National Herald case.

29.title: Do you have democracy in Congress: Ravi Shankar to Rahul Gandhi
29.article_body: Replying to Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's "death of democracy" comment, BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said that Rahul Gandhi should not preach on democracy. "Do you have democracy in your party? If the country has seen dictatorship, then it has seen in the rule of Congress," said Prasad. He further added that Rahul is not serious about politics.

30.title: Drake launches T-shirt in honour of Sidhu Moose Wala
30.article_body: Rapper Drake has launched a T-shirt in honour of Sidhu Moose Wala. "We celebrate your life and influence in India, Canada, everywhere. Rest in peace to our friend and legend...We are working with Sidhu's family to dedicate proceeds from this drop in his honour," the rapper wrote in an Instagram post.

31.title: I'm bored of it, still attached to it: Naga Chaitanya on his divorce news
31.article_body: While talking about media reports after his divorce with actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, actor Naga Chaitanya said, "It's just people trying to fill up columns and there's nothing else. I mean I'm bored of it. I have been through three releases and I'm still attached to it." "We both have immense respect for each other," he added.

32.title: His silver medal at CWG is a special one: PM Modi on long jumper Sreeshankar
32.article_body: Congratulating Murali Sreeshankar following his silver medal in men's long jump final at Commonwealth Games 2022, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Sreeshankar's silver medal at the CWG is a special one...his performance augurs well for the future of Indian athletics." President Droupadi Murmu said, "Your long leap has brought India's first ever medal for this event in the Commonwealth Games."

33.title: 42 migrant workers died in Gurugram this year: Police
33.article_body: At least 42 migrant workers died in Gurugram until July 30 this year, out of these, 20 workers were killed in accidents at construction sites, police said. These accidents included caving in of soil while digging basements, falling from multi-storey buildings, electrocution etc. The remaining 22 deaths were reported from offices, workshops, factories and other workplaces, police added.

34.title: Bezos' $500 mn yacht towed from Dutch shipyard as dismantling of bridge cancelled
34.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' $500 million megayacht was towed away from a Dutch shipyard weeks after its manufacturer withdrew request to dismantle a bridge built in 1927 to allow passage for the vessel. The 417-foot-long yacht was relocated early Tuesday morning to the Greenport yard in Rotterdam. Earlier, local residents threatened to egg the yacht if the bridge was dismantled.

35.title: A lot of question marks now present themselves: Styris on KL Rahul
35.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris said there are a "lot of question marks" over opportunities for KL Rahul in Team India's lineup, having not played any competitive cricket since IPL 2022. "Other players are...scoring runs and...posing the selectors some questions saying, 'Do we actually need Rahul?'" added Styris. "[Will] Rahul...be in good form when he comes back?" stated Styris.

36.title: Bajrang begins India's wrestling campaign at CWG 2022 with a win, reaches quarter-finals
36.article_body: Olympic bronze medal-winning wrestler Bajrang Punia began India's wrestling campaign at CWG 2022 with a victory against Lowe Bingham of Nauru in the men's freestyle 65 kg category. With the victory, Bajrang advanced to the quarter-finals. Bajrang had bagged gold medal at CWG 2018 and a silver medal at CWG 2014.

37.title: World's smallest singer Abdu Rozik to play gangster in Salman's 'Bhaijaan'
37.article_body: Tajikistan-born Abdu Rozik, the world's smallest singer, will make his Bollywood debut with Salman Khan's upcoming movie 'Bhaijaan'. Talking to The Indian Express, the 18-year-old singer said, "I'm playing a gangster in the movie, small bhaijaan to the big bhaijaan." Abdu, who met Salman at IIFA 2022, added that he is a great human being who has a good heart.

38.title: TRS to support Opposition candidate in Vice-Presidential poll
38.article_body: TRS is set to support Opposition's candidate Margaret Alva for the Vice-Presidential election, slated to be held on August 6. Alva filed her nomination for the polls on July 19. On the other hand, NDA has fielded West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar as its candidate. Tenure of incumbent Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu will end on August 10.

39.title: Gold worth over ₹69 lakh seized at Bengaluru Airport; 2 arrested
39.article_body: Bengaluru Customs officials on Wednesday arrested two people for trying to smuggle over 1 kg gold worth ₹69.74 lakh. Based on specific intelligence, officials intercepted two passengers who had arrived from Sri Lanka and recovered gold that was concealed inside their rectum, Bengaluru Customs tweeted. Last month, over 500 grams of gold was recovered from one passenger at Bengaluru Airport.

40.title: 106-year-old college astronomy lab in Bihar added to UNESCO heritage list
40.article_body: A 106-year-old astronomical observatory in Bihar has been added to UNESCO's list of important endangered heritage observatories. The observatory, established in Langat Singh College in Muzaffarpur in 1916, is reportedly the first of its kind in eastern India. The college authorities said they're hopeful the state government will take steps for conserving it after its inclusion in UNESCO's list.

41.title: Disney scrapped our holiday special, RIP Shang Chi: Simu Liu
41.article_body: Actor Simu Liu announced on Twitter that Disney has scrapped the upcoming Shang-Chi Holiday Special over "quality control concerns". The actor wrote, "I had already filmed the entire thing. I even designed an all-gingerbread Ta Lo. RIP Shang Chi and the Legend of the TEEEN GOLDEN RIIIIINGS." Disney or Marvel have not yet released a statement over the matter.

42.title: My parents never bothered me over relationship with Mathias Boe: Taapsee
42.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has stated that her parents have never bothered her with questions about what she does in her personal or professional life. She is dating badminton player-turned-coach Mathias Boe. "They are happy with the way I have dealt with both aspects of my life and ensured I don't ignore one for the other," the actress added.

43.title: TN CM Stalin changes profile pic to Karunanidhi with national flag
43.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Thursday changed the profile picture on his social media handles to a photo of late DMK head and former state CM M Karunanidhi with the national flag in the background. Stalin, who is Karunanidhi's son, also stated that his father ensured state CMs' right to hoist the national flag on August 15 in 1974.

44.title: 2 arrested for stabbing cab driver to death in Delhi
44.article_body: Two men were arrested from Palam Vihar on Tuesday for allegedly stabbing a cab driver to death on July 15. According to police, the accused, who had booked the cab online, poured chilli powder into the driver's eyes to force him to share his UPI code for transferring money from his bank account. The incident took place in Faridabad's Pali.

45.title: Para table tennis player Bhavina reaches final, assures India of another medal at CWG
45.article_body: Para table tennis player Bhavina Patel assured India of another medal at CWG 2022 by reaching the final of the women's singles classes 3-5 event. The 35-year-old defeated England's Sue Bailey in the semi-final. Notably, Bhavina had bagged a silver medal at the Tokyo Paralympics last year, which was India's first-ever medal in para table tennis in Paralympic history.

46.title: 32-yr-old FTII student found dead in hostel room, police say 'likely suicide'
46.article_body: A 32-year-old final year student was found dead inside the hostel room of Film and Television Institute of India. Police were called after the student did not open door after repeated requests. "Upon opening door, it was ascertained that the death may have occurred a few days ago," police said, describing it as "likely suicide".

47.title: PMC initiates process for third-party quality audit of 640 roads
47.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has initiated the process for a third-party audit of construction quality of 640 roads in the city amid complaints about the state of roads. The roads were identified under Defect Liability Period, which is a clause in the contract wherein the contractor can be held liable for deterioration of a road's quality within a specific period.

48.title: Cyclone Tauktae uprooted 3.5 mn+ trees in Gir National Park: Guj Forest Dept
48.article_body: Cyclone Tauktae uprooted over 3.5 million trees in Gujarat's Gir National Park in May 2021, the state Forest Department has said after multiple surveys. Reports said the state Forest Department has submitted its final report on fallen trees over a year after Cyclone Tauktae. The department has estimated 30% of the trees in Gir were uprooted based on satellite data.

49.title: Twitter didn't disclose its risky litigation against Indian govt amid merger: Musk
49.article_body: In its countersuit against Twitter, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the company did not disclose that it had filed for "risky" litigation against the Indian government amid their deal, thereby "placing its third-largest market at risk". Musk added that Twitter must follow the laws in India. Meanwhile, Twitter replied that it has challenged certain blocking orders by the Indian government.

50.title: 'You've never seen Earth like this,' says ESA on pics depicting ground motion
50.article_body: European Space Agency (ESA) shared pictures depicting ground motion around Mount Etna and Bologna in Italy, as well as an area around Larissa in Greece. "You've never seen Earth like this," ESA captioned the post. "Any movement beneath our feet...spells big trouble. Even relatively modest subsidence can weaken buildings and infrastructure and lead to issues such as flooding," it said.

51.title: Canada requests extradition of French priest accused of child abuse
51.article_body: Canadian Justice Minister David Lametti on Thursday confirmed that Canada has requested the extradition of a French priest accused of sexually abusing indigenous children over 30 years ago. The accused priest left Canada in 1993. Last month, Pope Francis visited Canada and apologised for the role of the Catholic Church in carrying out abuse of indigenous children at residential schools.

52.title: Take family's consent, I'd rather stay in India: Anil on refusing H'wood shows
52.article_body: While talking about turning down Hollywood shows, actor Anil Kapoor said that he would rather stay in India and do what he can here. "I take my family's consent. If they say yes, I do it. I didn't ask earlier, but now I have to ask them if I can stay away from them for so many months," he added.

53.title: Reconsider spending on ads under 'Beti Bachao' scheme: Parl panel to govt
53.article_body: The parliamentary standing committee has urged the Centre to reconsider spending on advertisements under the 'Beti Bachao Beti Padhao' (BBBP) scheme. The panel said that more than 78% of ₹446.72 crore released during 2016-2019 for the scheme was spent only on media advocacy. It added that the government should instead focus on planned expenditure allocation in education and health.

54.title: China sanctions Nancy Pelosi and her family over Taiwan visit
54.article_body: China on Friday announced sanctions on US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and her immediate family members over her trip to Taiwan. The development comes days after Pelosi landed in Taipei despite several warnings from China, becoming the highest ranking US politician to visit Taiwan in 25 years. Earlier today, Pelosi said the US will "not allow China to isolate Taiwan".

55.title: The only thing I liked about K3G was Kareena Kapoor: Aamir Khan
55.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has revealed that the only thing that he liked about filmmaker Karan Johar's 2001 film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' was actress Kareena Kapoor. Kareena portrayed the character of Poo in the film which features Shah Rukh Khan, Kajol and Hrithik Roshan. Aamir added that he also liked Karan's directorial debut 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'.

56.title: Rahul is 'fake' Gandhi with 'fake' ideology: Pralhad Joshi
56.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Friday called Congress leader Rahul Gandhi a "fake" Gandhi whose ideology was "fake" as well. "He (Rahul Gandhi) is not a descendant of Mahatma Gandhi," Joshi added. His remarks came after Rahul said Congress was fighting for an ideology for years and the Gandhi family wasn't just one family, but an ideology as a whole.

57.title: HDFC raises ₹8,700 crore 'social loan' for affordable housing segment
57.article_body: HDFC Limited has raised $1.1 billion (around ₹8,700 crore) under the 'Syndicated Social Loan Facility' by way of external commercial borrowings (ECBs) to cater to the affordable housing segment, the company said on Friday. This is the first social ECB loan out of India and the largest ECB loan deal from a housing finance company/private NBFC in India, it added.

58.title: Road to salvation lies through incessant toil: RBI Guv quotes Gandhi after repo rate hike
58.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Friday ended his speech at the Monetary Policy Committee with a quote by Mahatma Gandhi. Das quoted, "For me, the road to salvation lies through incessant toil in the service of my country and there through of humanity." RBI on Friday increased the repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40%, the highest since 2019.

59.title: Air hostess died at Gurugram hospital after being treated by dentist for vaginal bleeding: CBI
59.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation said in its FIR that Rosy Sangma, an air hostess from Nagaland, died due to negligence by a Gurugram private hospital in June last year. The FIR stated that the "critical patient of vaginal bleeding was treated by a dentist who was not at all qualified for the same".

60.title: No details on if Hyderabad was ever named Bhagyanagar: ASI
60.article_body: In a response to an RTI inquiry on if Hyderabad was ever named Bhagnagar or Bhagyanagar, the city's Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) said, "No such details are available with this office." This comes after former Jharkhand CM and BJP leader Raghubar Das said that Hyderabad's name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana.

61.title: Walmart cuts 200 corporate jobs in restructuring effort
61.article_body: Walmart Inc is firing nearly 200 corporate employees in a restructuring effort and workers at its Bentonville, Arkansas headquarters and other corporate offices have been notified. Walmart called the move a way to "better position the company for a strong future". This comes after the company cut its quarterly and full-year profit guidance last month.

62.title: No GST on 'Sarais' run by religious, charitable trusts: Govt
62.article_body: Refuting certain media and social media reports claiming that GST has been imposed on 'Sarais' run by religious/charitable trusts, the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) said, "This is not true." It further said that GST exemption on hotel rooms with room rent up to ₹1,000 per day has been withdrawn and they are now taxed at 12%.

63.title: Hong Kong firm's stock rallies 32,000% in 3 weeks to surpass Goldman Sachs in value
63.article_body: Hong Kong-based financial company AMTD Digital's shares surged 32,000% in less than three weeks after listing in New York. Even though the shares have now lost more than half of their value, the company is still worth more than Goldman Sachs in terms of market capitalisation. Notably, AMTD reported just $25 million in revenue for the year ended April 2021.

64.title: Rajamouli narrated the plot in less than 10 seconds: Sudeepa on 'Makkhi'
64.article_body: Actor Kichcha Sudeepa, who worked with 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli in 'Makkhi' said Rajamouli narrated the film's plot in less than 10 seconds. "I just accepted it," added Sudeepa. Sudeepa was also part of Rajamouli's film 'Baahubali: The Beginning' but wasn't "called" to play the role in the sequel. "I didn't miss being in the second part," he had stated.

65.title: Man axes wife to death; later rushes to Udaipur forest, kills himself
65.article_body: A 44-year-old man, Fata Meena, allegedly killed his wife, Chanda Devi, by hitting her with an axe in Udaipur. Police said that the accused later locked the house and rushed to a forest, where he also died by suicide. Police also said that the couple used to pick fights often. Their bodies were handed over to the family after post-mortem.

66.title: Man who threatened to kill top US health expert Fauci jailed
66.article_body: A 56-year-old US man was sentenced on Thursday to three years in prison for sending threatening emails to top US health expert Anthony Fauci and other health officials. In one of the emails, Thomas Connally Jr threatened that Fauci and his family would be "dragged into the street, beaten to death, and set on fire", the US Justice Department said.

67.title: China has the sovereign right to hold military drills around Taiwan: Russia
67.article_body: Russia said China has the "sovereign right" to hold major military drills around Taiwan. "The tension in the region and around Taiwan was provoked...by the visit of [US House Speaker] Nancy Pelosi," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. "It was an absolutely unnecessary visit and an unnecessary provocation," Peskov added. China began its largest-ever military drills around Taiwan on Thursday.

68.title: Fake news: Carl Pei on report of Nothing Phone (1) Lite launch in India
68.article_body: Nothing CEO and Co-founder Carl Pei dismissed a report that claimed that the company was working to launch a Nothing Phone (1) Lite version. Pei remarked, "Fake news" in response to a report that stated that the Nothing Phone (1) Lite will be an affordable version of the Nothing Phone (1) and may launch in India soon, likely before Diwali.

69.title: UK may enter its longest recession since 2008 this year, warns Bank of England
69.article_body: The UK is projected to enter recession from fourth quarter of this year, the Bank of England has warned. It's expected to last for five quarters in what would be the UK's longest recession since the 2008 global financial crisis. "Inflation hits the least well-off hardest, but if we don't act...the consequences later will be worse," Governor Andrew Bailey said.

70.title: South filmmakers, actors getting their national dues: Dulquer Salmaan
70.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has stated that South filmmakers and actors are getting their national dues now, adding that it is a big compliment. He further said that any industry going through a rough patch is just a phase. "It's an interesting phase for...industries across [the world]. Not just in India, every film industry is facing the same," the actor added.

71.title: If I spoke perfect Punjabi, people might not understand: Aamir on 'Laal...'
71.article_body: Reacting to criticism over his Punjabi accent in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actor Aamir Khan said, "If I spoke perfect Punjabi, others might not understand, even if you do." "It would be better if you can judge these aspects after watching the film," added Aamir. Actress Sargun Mehta had stated that Aamir could have done better with his Punjabi accent.

72.title: Turn those who want to be villains in your life into comedians: Kangana
72.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut penned a note on Instagram Stories, writing, "Those who want to be villains in your life make them comedians and it will be a good story." She further wrote, "Never see yourself from the eyes of those who fail to appreciate you...Use their criticism to grow and...don't forget to rub it in their faces and have fun."

73.title: I won't rest till I get a gold medal: CWG silver medallist Tulika
73.article_body: Judoka Tulika Maan, who won a silver medal at CWG 2022, said she won't rest till she wins a gold medal. "I didn't come here to win a silver medal," she added. "When the probables were decided a year ago, Tulika wasn't...picked. She [reduced] her weight...to 85 kg from 115 kg," said coach Jiwan Sharma, who accompanied the judo contingent.

74.title: U'khand govt to develop a Sanskrit-speaking village in each district
74.article_body: The Uttarakhand government has decided to develop one Sanskrit-speaking village in each of its 13 districts. State Sanskrit Education Minister Dhan Singh Rawat said that teachers will be sent to selected villages to teach the people how to communicate in the language and such villages will be called "Sanskrit Gram". Villagers will also be taught Vedas and Puranas, he added.

75.title: Father chops son's hand after he refuses to hand over bike keys in MP
75.article_body: A man chopped off his son's hand in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district after the son refused to hand over the keys of his bike to him. "Moti [accused] asked for the keys of the bike but Santosh [son] refused to give them. [Moti] and his brother thrashed Santosh...Moti picked up an axe...[and] chopped his left hand," Police said.

76.title: K'taka HC upholds ban on sale of firecrackers within B'luru city limits
76.article_body: Karnataka High Court has upheld the ban on the sale of firecrackers imposed by the police department within Bengaluru city limits. "In dense cities like Bangalore, that [is] plagued with ceaseless sound pollution...bursting of crackers would only add to the existing woes," Justice Krishna S Dixit observed. He further noted that fireworks in narrow lanes could cause a chain reaction.

77.title: Congress leaders including Rahul, Tharoor detained during protest over price rise
77.article_body: Congress leaders including Rahul Gandhi and Shashi Tharoor were detained during a protest against the Centre over price rise and unemployment. "All Congress MPs were marching towards Rashtrapati Bhavan to raise the issue of inflation and price rise...they aren't allowing us to go ahead from here," Gandhi said. Section 144 has been imposed in New Delhi district amid the protest.

78.title: Coimbatore post offices begin selling National Flag
78.article_body: Post offices in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore are selling the National Flag as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign ahead of the 75th Independence Day. PM Narendra Modi on July 31 urged everyone to turn the campaign into a mass movement by hoisting the National Flag at their homes. Citizens can also buy the National Flag online through e-portal service.

79.title: Akshay cries after sister's message, says 'Lives changed after this goddess'
79.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar was left in tears while on a reality show after listening to his sister's message. "We used to live in a small house. After the arrival of this goddess, our lives changed. There is no bigger relationship than that with a sister," he said. "You stood beside me at all times, good and bad," his sister said.

80.title: American singer Ne-Yo's wife files for divorce, says 'he had kid with another woman'
80.article_body: Ne-Yo's wife Crystal Renay Smith has reportedly filed for divorce from the American singer, claiming that he recently fathered a child with another woman. Renay, who married Ne-Yo in February 2016, filed divorce documents earlier this week in Atlanta saying the couple's marriage is "irretrievably broken with no hope for reconciliation". Renay and Ne-Yo have three children together.

81.title: Centre misusing central agencies to suppress Opposition: Baghel
81.article_body: Talking about National Herald case, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel criticised Centre for its "dictatorial attitude" and alleged that the government is misusing central agencies to "suppress" the Opposition. "A dictatorial attitude has been adopted. We respect all the...agencies, but the way they are acting is unfortunate. It's being used to crush, suppress the Opposition," said Baghel.

82.title: Kishore Kumar fans demand Bharat Ratna, home to be declared heritage site
82.article_body: Several fan groups of late actor-singer Kishore Kumar have demanded a posthumous Bharat Ratna for him. They have also asked for Kishore's ancestral home in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa to be declared a heritage site. Kishore Prerna Manch President Ranveer Singh Chawal has stated that over 2,000 postcards have been sent to the Prime Minister's Office with the demands.

83.title: Piped cooking gas price hiked by ₹2.63 per unit in Delhi, 2nd hike in 2 weeks
83.article_body: The price of piped cooking gas in Delhi has been hiked by ₹2.63 per unit due to the rise in input costs, Indraprastha Gas Limited said. The piped gas was priced at ₹47.96 per standard cubic meter (SCM). It will now cost ₹50.59 per SCM. Notably, this is the second hike in the price in less than two weeks.

84.title: French PM announces creation of new LGBTQ ambassador job
84.article_body: French PM Elisabeth Borne on Thursday said that the country will create an ambassador's post to promote LGBTQ rights worldwide. The LGBTQ envoy will coordinate the Foreign Ministry's policy, act as "France's voice" and will "campaign for the decriminalisation everywhere of homosexuality and trans identity", Borne added. The ambassador will be appointed by the end of the year.

85.title: Finance Minister has zero understanding of India's economic situation: Rahul
85.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that he thinks Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has "zero understanding" of what is going on in the economy of India. Rahul said this while addressing a press conference in Delhi. "I think the macroeconomic fundamentals that she is talking about is something else...[Sitharaman] is there as a mouthpiece," he added.

86.title: 16 lakh+ Delhi vehicle owners may face jail or penalty over invalid PUC
86.article_body: According to reports, if vehicles without valid PUC are caught plying on Delhi roads, owners may face imprisonment of up to six months or  fine of up to ₹10,000 or both as per Motor Vehicle Act. About 13 lakh two-wheelers and three lakh cars were plying in Delhi without valid Pollution Under Control certificate as of July 18, reports said.

87.title: It's a network, all should be arrested: BJP leader on WB SSC scam
87.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Thursday held a protest with other party members against the TMC-led state government over the SSC recruitment scam. Majumdar said the corruption that had happened was not possible by one person. "It's a network...all those involved should be arrested," he added. Last month, ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested in the case.

88.title: Adani Enterprises' Q1 profit rises 76% to ₹469 cr, revenue up 223%
88.article_body: Adani Enterprises Limited (AEL) on Thursday reported a 76.48% rise in consolidated profit at ₹468.74 crore for the quarter ended June as against  ₹265.60 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its consolidated revenue from operations in Q1 increased by 223% to ₹41,066.43 crore. Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani said that the group intends to leverage AEL's incubation strategy model.

89.title: She's worthy: Hemsworth as fan says 'Time for Thor to give up hammer' after Mirabai's gold
89.article_body: Actor Chris Hemsworth, who plays Thor in the Marvel movies, responded to an Indian fan over his tweet on Indian weightlifter Saikhom Mirabai Chanu's gold medal at CWG 2022. Referring to Mirabai's gold, the fan tagged Hemsworth and tweeted, "Time for Thor to give up his hammer." Hemsworth responded by writing, "She is worthy! Congrats, Saikhom, you legend!"

90.title: 5 dead, 10 injured as tempo hits car and falls into deep gorge in J&K
90.article_body: At least five persons were killed and 10 others were injured on Thursday as a tempo they were travelling in hit a car and fell into a deep gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban, police said. The vehicle was on its way to Jammu from Banihal, police added. The accident took place after the tempo's brakes failed, police stated.

91.title: Crude oil might see 10% weekly collapse as demand hit: Report
91.article_body: Oil is heading towards a 10% weekly loss as the demand for crude oil was hit by an economic slowdown globally, a Bloomberg report said. The West Texas Intermediate (WTI) was below $89/barrel in Asia, with the US benchmark down over 10% this week. According to official data, crude stockpiles increased even as gasoline consumption decreased in the US.

92.title: Women banned from appearing in ads in Iran over ad showing woman biting ice cream
92.article_body: Iran's Ministry of Culture and Islamic Guidance has banned women from appearing in adverts under the country's strict rules. The announcement came after a commercial featuring a woman biting an ice cream. Iranian officials ruled that the advertisement went "against public decency" and was an "insult" to "women's values".

93.title: India grappling with the problem of high inflation: RBI Governor
93.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that India is grappling with the problem of high inflation. "Indian economy has naturally been impacted by the global economic situation," the Governor said, adding that the globalisation of inflation is coinciding with de-globalisation of trade. "Nevertheless...India is expected to be amongst the fastest growing economies during 2022-23," he said, citing the IMF.

94.title: People are surprised that Masaba & I call each other 2-3 times a day: Neena
94.article_body: Veteran actress Neena Gupta has revealed that she and her daughter designer Masaba don't live together but keep calling each other. "So many people express surprise when they come to know that we call each other up two-three times a day," she added. Neena further said that she gets to know whatever is trending due to her daughter Masaba.

95.title: She was 12-yr-old on 'Andaz...' sets, came with Karisma: Aamir on Kareena
95.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that his first impression of actress Kareena Kapoor Khan was a "really cute 12-year-old girl who was sitting on the sets of 'Andaz Apna Apna'". "She used to come with Lolo [Karisma Kapoor]," Aamir added, while answering a question during his time of 'Koffee With Karan 7'.

96.title: Speeding truck hits school bus from behind in UP; over 24 kids hurt
96.article_body: Over 24 children were injured, including five who sustained serious injuries, after a speeding dumper truck rammed into a school bus as it stopped to pick up a student in Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh on Thursday. Due to the collision, the school bus also hit a tree on the roadside. The school bus driver was also injured in the incident.

97.title: ISRO's smallest rocket to launch satellite built by 750 school girls on Aug 7
97.article_body: ISRO will be launching its smallest commercial rocket, Small Satellite Launch Vehicle (SSLV), on August 7. The SSLV will carry a satellite, AzaadiSAT, comprising 75 payloads built by 750 girl students from 75 rural government schools across India. The project is part of the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav celebrations, to mark the 75th Independence Day year celebrations.

98.title: Loss vs Pak in T20 WC 2021 caused Team India a 'lot' of damage: Latif
98.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said India's defeat against Pakistan by 10 wickets in T20 World Cup 2021 caused the former a "lot of damage", which they are trying to recover from. "They are taking it series by series...Teams are changing with every series," added Latif. Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar earlier said Pakistan will beat India in T20 World Cup 2022.

99.title: Hyd Customs seize cigarettes, protein powder worth ₹1.15 cr; 14 arrested
99.article_body: Hyderabad Customs on Thursday arrested 14 people for trying to smuggle cigarettes and protein powder into the country. The passengers, who arrived from different flights, were found carrying 150 bottles of protein powder, 4,792 e-cigarettes and over two lakh cigarettes, all worth ₹1.15 crore, Hyderabad Customs tweeted. Last month, officials seized cigarettes worth ₹50 lakh at Hyderabad Airport.

100.title: Pune ACB books PCMC surveyor for demanding bribe of ₹3 lakh
100.article_body: The Pune unit of the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has booked a surveyor of the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹3 lakh from a private company's employee. The accused had reportedly demanded the bribe to give a "development opinion" in favour of the company's development plan. The ACB verified the complaint multiple times.

101.title: New batch of IIM-I's online Exec PG Diploma starts Aug 13: Unext Jigsaw
101.article_body: IIM Indore & UNext Jigsaw announced that the last few seats are remaining for their online PGDP in Management & AI designed for professionals with 3+ years of work experience. Through the 15-month program, learners can gain Executive alumni status, network with MDs & VPs of top corporate firms, and experience week-long campus immersion with other campus benefits, Jigsaw added.

102.title: India witnessing death of democracy, onset of dictatorship: Rahul Gandhi
102.article_body: Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that India is witnessing the "death of democracy" and "onset of dictatorship". "Anybody who stands against this idea is viciously attacked, put in jail, arrested and beaten up," he added. "What India has built brick by brick, starting almost a century ago, is basically being destroyed in front of your eyes," Gandhi further said.

103.title: Gave 1st screen test in 22 yrs as Aamir wasn't confident: Kareena on 'Laal...'
103.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor said she gave her first screen test in 22 years for her role in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' as Aamir Khan wasn't confident. "Aamir was very sure that I had to screen test...It was actually [my husband] Saif Ali Khan who told me...listen...it's really cool because only Aamir...can actually tell someone...that you have to screen test," she added.

104.title: Centre will take all accounts of Congress' wrongdoings: Haryana CM
104.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar defended ED's action against the Congress leaders in the National Herald case and claimed that Centre will take all accounts of Congress' wrongdoings. The CM said, "Congress has already looted Haryana. We are going to take all the accounts of this loot from them in Delhi as well as in Haryana."

105.title: Narendra Modi is best PM ever: Kuldeep Bishnoi after joining BJP
105.article_body: After joining the BJP along with his wife and former MLA Renuka Bishnoi on Thursday, former Haryana MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi told reporters that it would not be wrong to describe PM Narendra Modi as "India's best PM". "I and my associates had been part of...[BJP's] campaign in 2014 Lok Sabha polls when Narendra Modi became the PM," he said.

106.title: Amnesty accuses Ukraine of 'putting civilians at risk', Zelenskyy responds
106.article_body: Ukrainian forces are violating the laws of war and endangering civilians by establishing bases in residential areas, including in hospitals, Amnesty International said in a report. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy condemned the report and said Amnesty International had tried to "amnesty the terrorist state and shift the responsibility from the aggressor [Russia] to the victim [Ukraine]".

107.title: BJP is horrified, is it going to declare Shah as Guj CM face: Kejriwal
107.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal said that the Bharatiya Janata Party is "horrified" because "AAP is growing rapidly in Gujarat". "Is it true that the BJP is going to declare Amit Shah ji as the chief ministerial face in the Gujarat Assembly polls? Is the BJP also angry with Bhupendra bhai Patel's work?" he asked.

108.title: 'Horrible raj': Congress MP after ED questions Kharge
108.article_body: Congress MP KC Venugopal criticised the Centre after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) questioned senior party leader Mallikarjun Kharge in connection with the National Herald case. "Horrible raj is going on in the country. There are parliamentary systems. We are law-abiding citizens...Privilege for Members of Parliament exists for the safeguarding of democracy," said Venugopal.

109.title: Pic of long jumper Sreeshankar's foul by 1 cm at CWG goes viral, fans say 'Robbed of gold'
109.article_body: A picture of Indian long jumper Murali Sreeshankar's foul at CWG 2022 has gone viral. In his fourth attempt, Sreeshankar seemingly crossed the 8-metre mark, however, his jump was declared invalid as he was adjudged to have overstepped the take-off board by 1 cm. "Robbed of gold medal," a fan tweeted. "How can that be a foul?" wrote another.

110.title: Why didn't India's Sreeshankar get gold despite having joint-best jump in CWG 2022 final?
110.article_body: India's Murali Sreeshankar won silver medal in the men's long jump event at CWG 2022 despite having the joint-best jump. Sreeshankar had a best jump of 8.08 metres, the same as gold medallist LaQuan Nairn of Bahamas. Nairn bagged the gold medal as on countback, his second-best jump of 7.98 metres was 14 cm better than Sreeshankar's 7.84 metres.

111.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India clinch 20 medals?
111.article_body: After the conclusion of Day 7, India's medal tally at CWG 2022 has reached 20. With six gold medals, seven silver medals and seven bronze medals, India are placed seventh on the medal standings. Scotland, who have bagged seven gold medals and a total of 34 medals, are placed fifth. Meanwhile, South Africa are placed sixth on the table.

112.title: India's real GDP growth projection for 2022-23 retained at 7.2%: RBI
112.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, while announcing the central bank's monetary policy decision, said that India's real GDP growth projection for 2022-23 has been retained at 7.2%. The RBI also retained its retail inflation forecast for the current financial year at 6.7%. Retail inflation has remained above the RBI's upper band of 2%-6% tolerance range for the last six consecutive months.

113.title: Jharkhand High Court bans promotions of state government employees
113.article_body: Jharkhand High Court has put a ban on all promotions of state government employees. HC was hearing a plea regarding the June 23 order of the Director General of Police on granting promotions to Assistant Sub-Inspectors (ASIs) to the post of Sub-Inspectors (SIs). DGP's order stated that reserved category ASIs can seek promotion in the general category, the petitioner claimed.

114.title: Sonam shares pic of her swollen feet, says 'pregnancy is not pretty sometimes'
114.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor shared a picture of her swollen feet on Instagram and wrote, "Pregnancy is not pretty sometimes." The actress is expecting her first child with husband Anand Ahuja. Sonam, who announced her pregnancy in March, had hosted a baby shower in London. Sonam and Anand got married in May 2018.

115.title: Quite surprised, don't know the reason: R Sridhar on Suryakumar opening
115.article_body: Ex-India fielding coach R Sridhar said he was "quite surprised" to see Suryakumar Yadav open during the T20I series against West Indies, adding he really doesn't know the reason behind this decision. "There is something happening...which we're not aware about," he stated. Sridhar said he immediately checked whether Rishabh Pant was playing on seeing Suryakumar open in the first T20I.

116.title: Modi govt keen to cut short Monsoon Session: TMC's Derek O'Brien
116.article_body: TMC leader Derek O'Brien on Thursday said, "Why is Narendra Modi government running away from Parliament?" "The talk on Parliament Street is that the government is keen to cut short the Monsoon Session and end it on August 8, instead of August 12. Bad," O'Brien tweeted. Last year, all three sessions of the Parliament were curtailed due to various reasons.

117.title: Paytm payments down for many users, company says 'Working on the issue'
117.article_body: Several users have been unable to access Paytm payments on Friday as the app is facing an outage. Users reported they were being logged out suddenly and have been unable to log back in. Outage detection website DownDetector also confirmed the issue on the app. Meanwhile, Paytm tweeted, "We are already working on fixing the issue at the earliest."

118.title: Even getting here is huge: Helly on 'Zibah' qualifying for Oscar nomination
118.article_body: Speaking about her film 'Zibah' qualifying for getting nominated for Oscars, actress Helly Shah said that it's big news. "Sirf yaha tak pohchna hi badi baat hai humare liye (Even getting here is a huge deal for us)," she added. Helly had recently announced that 'Zibah' is among the top three Indian films to get a theatrical screening in LA.

119.title: Congress to protest outside Raj Bhavan in Himachal Pradesh
119.article_body: Congress will hold a demonstration outside Raj Bhavan in Himachal Pradesh on Friday as part of its nationwide campaign against rising inflation and unemployment. "The entire country is suffering due to inflation...Congress is on the streets against the anti-people policies of the BJP government. The [Centre] is misusing institutions...to suppress the Opposition," said Congress leader Alka Lamba.

120.title: Protesting villagers don't let SDM leave office for 6 hrs in Punjab
120.article_body: Residents of Lehal Khurd village in Punjab on Thursday gheraoed Lehra Sub-Divisional Magistrate's (SDM) office and didn't let the SDM leave the office for around six hours in a protest. The villagers demanded that two additional teachers' posts should be created in a primary school. The SDM said that a senior official has been informed about the protesters' demand.

121.title: You will be missed: Hrithik condoles demise of Mithilesh Chaturvedi
121.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter to condole the demise of veteran actor Mithilesh Chaturvedi. He wrote, "Thoughts & prayers for Mithilesh Chaturvedi Sir, a veteran actor who I've had the pleasure of working with multiple times. You will be missed. RIP." The two had worked together in 2003 film 'Koi... Mil Gaya' and 2006 film 'Krrish'.

122.title: India reports 20,551 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,35,364
122.article_body: India has reported 20,551 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 19,893 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,35,364, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,600, according to the latest data.

123.title: Internal communication not material: Zomato on multiple CEOs & 'Eternal' restructuring
123.article_body: Regarding the company moving to a multiple CEO structure and rebranding itself 'Eternal' internally, Zomato told the BSE that it had not shared its CEO Deepinder Goyal's "internal communication" with the media. It said, "The internal communication is not material and does not mandate any disclosure." Their response came after SEBI sought clarification from Zomato regarding this restructuring.

124.title: RBI hikes repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40% in its third hike in 4 months
124.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das has announced that the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has decided to increase the repo rate by 50 bps to 5.40% with immediate effect. This is the third hike in the repo rate announced by the RBI since May. With the 50 bps hike, the interest rates will rise to pre-pandemic levels.

125.title: Many people have said I would be 'perfect' for SRK's role in Darr: Kartik
125.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said many people have told him that he would be "perfect" for the role played by SRK in the film 'Darr'. "The last 30 minutes of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' when the character of Rooh Baba changes and has relatively serious scenes, many people have said that I can play a grey character quite well," added Kartik.

126.title: Over 50 cattle die at cow shelter in UP's Amroha, CM Yogi orders probe
126.article_body: Over 50 cattle died under mysterious circumstances at a cow shelter in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha district on Thursday. According to District Magistrate BK Tripathi, the cows fell ill after eating fodder which was purchased from a man named Tahir. Following the incident, UP CM Yogi Adityanath ordered a probe and directed Animal Husbandry Minister Dharam Pal Singh to reach Amroha.

127.title: Bomb squad checks unclaimed tiffin box in Delhi, nothing suspicious found
127.article_body: An unclaimed tiffin box was found in Delhi's Rohini on Thursday, reports said. Reports added that a bomb squad was sent to the area to check the box. However, nothing suspicious was found. The National Security Guard was also called in. The area was sealed and the neighbouring areas were evacuated.

128.title: Croma announces 'Independence Day Sale 2022', offers special deals
128.article_body: On the occasion of India's 75th Independence Day, Croma has announced its 'Independence Day Sale 2022' from 5th to 16th August. Customers can get a slew of offers, discounts, EMI options, and other benefits on smartphones, TVs, laptops, tablets, washing machines, and other electronics during the sale.

129.title: Truck driver runs over woman, daughter after altercation over rash driving in Odisha
129.article_body: A 47-year-old woman and her daughter were run over by a truck driver in Odisha's Jajpur on Wednesday, shortly after they had an altercation with him over rash driving, police said. "The matter was resolved amicably after locals intervened," police added. The driver later mowed down the two, police stated. "We've arrested him...charged him under IPC Section 302," police added.

130.title: Kevin Spacey to pay $31 mn to 'House of Cards' maker for alleged sexual misconduct
130.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has been ordered to pay $31 million to the 'House of Cards' production company by a judge for alleged sexual misconduct. The 63-year-old was fired during the show's sixth season after allegations surfaced that he had sexually assaulted several men. Spacey failed to show that the $31 million award was "utterly irrational", an LA County judge said.

131.title: At least 13 killed, 35 injured in fire at nightclub in Thailand
131.article_body: At least 13 people have been killed and 35 others have been injured after a fire broke out at a nightclub in Thailand's Chonburi province on Friday, police said. The fire, which started at around 1 am, was brought under control after about three hours. So far, all the victims are Thai nationals, Police Colonel Wuttipong Somjai said.

132.title: 5 Chinese ballistic missiles land in Japan's exclusive economic zone
132.article_body: Japanese Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi on Thursday said that five Chinese ballistic missiles landed in Japan's exclusive economic zone. This comes as China launched its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit. "We have protested strongly through diplomatic channels," Kishi further said.

133.title: Unfair to hundreds who made it: Rahul on calls to boycott 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
133.article_body: Filmmaker Rahul Dholakia has reacted to the calls to boycott 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan'. He wrote on Twitter, "Trolling a film because a cast...[member's] ideology differs from yours is unfair to the other hundreds who...worked hard to make the film. They have also pinned their hopes on the success of the film to help [realise] their dreams."

134.title: I'm nobody to talk about it: Kareena on failure of Ranbir's 'Shamshera'
134.article_body: On being asked about her cousin Ranbir Kapoor's film 'Shamshera' failing at the box office, actress Kareena Kapoor said that she is nobody to talk about it. Kareena said she hasn't seen the film, adding that everybody treats their film very differently. "Every actor operates...from a different area...To comment on that would be very wrong on my part," Kareena added.

135.title: US urges Russia to accept 'serious offer' on freeing basketball player
135.article_body: The US urged Moscow to accept a deal to free basketball player Brittney Griner, who has been sentenced to nine years in a Russian prison over drug smuggling. "It's a serious proposal," White House National Security spokesperson John Kirby said, adding, "They should've accepted it weeks ago when we first made it." US President Joe Biden called Griner's sentence "unacceptable".

136.title: Sensex jumps over 100 points, Nifty above 17,400 in opening trade
136.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Friday with Sensex and Nifty surging 137.02 points and 42.70 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 58,435.82 points and Nifty at 17,424.70. Tata Steel, Ultratech Cement, L&T, ICICI Bank, M&M, and Bharti Airtel were among the top gainers, while GAIL and ONGC slipped. Nifty Metal and Nifty FMCG also saw a surge.

137.title: Will not allow China to isolate Taiwan: US
137.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Friday said that the US will "not allow China to isolate Taiwan". Responding to accusations that her trip showed that the US supports Taiwan's independence, Pelosi said, "We have said from the start that our representation here is not about changing the status quo here in Asia, changing the status quo in Taiwan."

138.title: Man kidnaps 4-month-old boy while grandparents have meal in Raj hospital
138.article_body: An unknown man kidnapped a four-month-old baby boy from a government hospital while the infant's grandparents were having a meal. The infant's family had brought him to the hospital, following which, he was admitted. The family met the kidnapper at the hospital. He had told them he was also accompanying a patient.

139.title: I had more kids than they made cars: Musk as Tesla rival sells 679 cars in Q2
139.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took a jibe at the rival electric car maker Lucid after its quarterly earnings report revealed that it delivered 679 cars in the second quarter. "I had more kids in Q2 than they made cars!" the world's richest person wrote on Twitter. Compared to Lucid, Tesla delivered more than 254,000 vehicles in second quarter of 2022.

140.title: Death toll due to spurious liquor consumption in Bihar's Saran reaches 8
140.article_body: The death toll due to consumption of spurious liquor in Chapra in Bihar's Saran district has reached eight. "Medical teams have been sent to the area in the village so that checkups can be done at every household," Saran DM Rajesh Meena said. Reportedly, some people also complained of loss of eyesight after consuming illicit liquor.

141.title: Anti-CAA protests sent wrong message to the world: RSS leader
141.article_body: Senior RSS leader Indresh Kumar said protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) at Jamia Millia Islamia sent a wrong message to the world. "When we thought of giving refuge to minorities from a nation which was...part of our country in the past...you should have had the humility to accept them," Kumar said while addressing a seminar at the university.

142.title: Actor Bradley Cooper's 'lookalike' wanted by police for shoplifting in US
142.article_body: Police in US' Henry County are searching for a man accused of shoplifting from a store. The man, who social media users said looked exactly like actor Bradley Cooper, is accused of stealing a Bosch Rotary Laser Kit from the Home depot in McDonough. "Bradley Cooper. I'd know that guy anywhere," a social media user commented on police's post.

143.title: I feel I've got another job: Big B on 22 years as host of Kaun Banega Crorepati
143.article_body: While talking about his 22 years as a host for the show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati', actor Amitabh Bachchan said that he feels like he has got another job. He also spoke about the questions that he asks on the show. "I don't know where [questions] come from but they are researched from various states...then forwarded to master computer," he added.

144.title: 4 US police officers charged over killing of 26-yr-old black woman
144.article_body: US prosecutors have charged four former and current Louisville police officers over a drug raid that led to the death of 26-year-old black woman Breonna Taylor in 2020. Prosecutors alleged that the officers falsified the affidavit used to obtain the search warrant of Taylor's home that led to her killing. Anti-racism protests were sparked in the US following Taylor's death.

145.title: Sec 144 imposed in New Delhi district ahead of Congress' nationwide protest
145.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in the entire New Delhi district, except Jantar Mantar, ahead of the Congress' nationwide protest on Friday. "Protest/dharna/gherao in the area of New Delhi district on August 5 cannot be permitted in view of security, law and order and traffic reasons," Delhi Police said. Congress will hold the protest over unemployment and inflation.

146.title: Waited for this for a very long time: Sreeshankar on historic silver
146.article_body: Having become the first Indian male athlete to win a silver medal in long jump at CWG, Murali Sreeshankar said, "I've...[waited] for this for a very long time. I desperately wanted a medal." Sreeshankar added he's disappointed he couldn't win the gold medal. He registered a best jump of 8.08m, helping India win its second athletics medal at CWG 2022.

147.title: B'wood had same tonality as South, Aamir's the reason we changed: Karan
147.article_body: Talking about Bollywood films struggling recently with movies like 'RRR' doing well, filmmaker Karan Johar told actor Aamir Khan, "There's a tonality that 'KGF'...or 'Pushpa' [have] that...Hindi cinema [had]. We...let go of it and you're responsible." Karan added Aamir starred in films like 'Lagaan' that resulted in a new audience. "You're wrong. Those were...heartland films," responded Aamir.

148.title: Jack Dorsey-led Block to slow hiring, reduce investments amid losses in Q2
148.article_body: Jack Dorsey-led Block has slowed its hiring and will reduce its 2022 investment target by $250 million as it reported a loss in the second quarter with falling Bitcoin prices. Block, which was formerly called Square, witnessed a total net revenue of $4.40 billion, down 6% from a year ago. Shares of Block fell nearly 6% on Thursday.

149.title: Mumbai man fights vendor over juice quantity; assaults constable, home guard
149.article_body: A man who was engaged in a fight with a vendor over being served less quantity of juice on Wednesday, also assaulted and manhandled a constable, Suraj Jadhav, and a home guard. The home guard was sent to spot but was told by the man that he would get him fired. The man also manhandled Jadhav by pulling his collar.

150.title: Live organs transported in 13 mins via green channel in Hyderabad
150.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Thursday provided a green channel for the transportation of live organs from Yashoda Hospitals in Malakpet to KIMS Hospitals in Begumpet. The traffic police also shared a video of the organs being transported with the hashtag '#SavingLives'. The traffic police tweeted that the distance of 11 km between the hospitals was covered in just 13 minutes.

151.title: Police arrest 8 people for gambling in Hyd, over ₹37,000 cash seized
151.article_body: Hyderabad's Kanchanbagh police on Wednesday arrested eight people on charges of gambling. Based on a tip-off, Sub-Inspector G Linga Raju raided a house in Hafeez Baba Nagar and found the accused playing card games and gambling. An amount of ₹37,620 in cash and a pack of cards were recovered during the raid. All accused are reportedly aged between 28-52 years.

152.title: Prostitution racket busted at Pune spa; 5 arrested, 4 women rescued
152.article_body: Pune City Police's crime branch busted a prostitution racket operating at a spa in the Wanwadi area and arrested two managers of the spa. Police also booked three more persons in the case and rescued four women. The women were allegedly lured into prostitution at the spa. The racket was busted after a decoy customer was sent to the spa.

153.title: 5 police personnel transferred for taking part in beauty pageant in Tamil Nadu
153.article_body: Five police personnel were transferred after they took part in a beauty pageant in Tamil Nadu, officials said on Friday. The transfer orders by the Nagapattinam Superintendent of Police came after the personnel walked the ramp at the beauty pageant. As per reports, the beauty contest was held last Sunday in Mayiladuthurai district by a private organisation.

154.title: 2 persons sexually assault & murder 7-yr-old girl in Pune; arrested
154.article_body: Pune Rural Police have arrested two persons for allegedly kidnapping, sexually assaulting and murdering a seven-year-old girl. The body of the girl, who was kidnapped on August 2, was found after around 18 hours behind a Zilla Parishad school in a village, according to the police. "Within 24 hours after the incident, we've arrested both the accused," an inspector said.

155.title: Dentist at Delhi's Tihar smuggles 82 grams of ganja into prison, held
155.article_body: A dentist at Delhi's Tihar Jail was arrested for allegedly smuggling 82 grams of ganja and some tobacco into the prison, police said on Thursday. He allegedly hid the drugs in his shoes and was frisked, police added. "The dentist had come to visit an inmate...was caught by officials while he was handing over the drugs," police stated.

156.title: Found new ₹2.25 crore trail linked to Sanjay Raut: ED to court
156.article_body: Enforcement Directorate on Thursday said a fresh trail of proceeds of crime of ₹2.25 crore, linked to Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, has been found in case of redevelopment of a chawl project in Mumbai. ED had said Raut and his family were direct beneficiaries of ₹1.06 crore linked to the case. ED arrested Raut in wee hours of Monday.

157.title: Musk didn't find $44 bn deal attractive after his massive wealth fell: Twitter
157.article_body: Twitter has responded to counterclaims made by Elon Musk over $44 billion buyout deal after the social media company sued him for trying to pull out of the agreement. "[The counterclaims are] a story, imagined in an effort to escape a merger agreement that Musk no longer found attractive once the stock market—and...his massive personal wealth—declined in value," Twitter said.

158.title: Not true: Musk on reports of building a private airport in Texas
158.article_body: Reacting to reports of him building a private airport in Texas, the world’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that is "not true". He added, "Tesla is five minutes from Austin international airport. [It] would be silly to build another private airport, however, the existing commercial airport needs another runway, as Austin is growing fast!"

159.title: Musk's claim that he was hoodwinked into signing deal is implausible: Twitter
159.article_body: Twitter has filed its response to claims made by the world's richest person Elon Musk that he was "hoodwinked" into signing the deal to buy the company. "According to Musk...the billionaire founder of multiple companies...[he] was hoodwinked by Twitter into signing a $44 billion merger agreement. That story is as implausible and contrary to fact as it sounds," Twitter said.

160.title: Sudhir wins India's first-ever gold medal in para powerlifting in CWG history
160.article_body: India's 27-year-old para powerlifter Sudhir clinched gold medal in the men's heavyweight category, taking India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to 20. It is India's first-ever gold medal in para powerlifting in the history of CWG. Sudhir had a best lift of 212 kg and he finished with 134.5 points in the final, setting a CWG record.

161.title: US declares monkeypox a public health emergency
161.article_body: The US government has declared monkeypox a public health emergency. The US has reported more than 6,600 probable or confirmed cases of the disease since the first case was identified in mid-May. The World Health Organization (WHO) had declared monkeypox a public health emergency of international concern last month.

162.title: Man beats up 2 stray dogs with stick, Pune Police launches probe
162.article_body: The Pune City Police is probing a case in which two stray dogs were severely beaten with a wooden stick in the Wagholi area on July 22. The incident was brought to the notice of the police by an animal welfare activist. The complainant said that the medical examination of the two dogs revealed severe injuries.

163.title: 24-yr-old arms supplier arrested in Delhi, 12 pistols recovered
163.article_body: A 24-year-old arms supplier was arrested along with weapons from Delhi, police said on Thursday. Twelve pistols were recovered from the accused, DCP (Special Cell) Jasmeet Singh said. He had been supplying firearms in Delhi-NCR, Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh for the last three years, Singh said. He has supplied over 400 firearms in Delhi-NCR in three years, police said.

164.title: Sreeshankar creates history, becomes first Indian man to win silver in long jump at CWG
164.article_body: Long jumper Murali Sreeshankar has created history by becoming the first Indian male athlete to win silver medal in long jump at CWG. The 23-year-old registered a best jump of 8.08m and bagged silver medal in men's long jump event at CWG 2022. It's India's second athletics medal at CWG 2022 after Tejaswin Shankar's bronze in men's high jump event.

165.title: Ukrainian forces exposing civilians to Russian attacks: Report
165.article_body: Ukraine has exposed its civilians to Russian fire as its forces occasionally set up bases in residential and populated areas, Amnesty International said on Thursday. Amnesty said between April and July, Ukraine launched attacks from residential areas in 19 towns. Ukrainian authorities dismissed the rights group's report, calling it “unfair” and a “disinformation and propaganda campaign.”

166.title: Rescue ops intensify to save 10 trapped coal miners in Mexico
166.article_body: Hundreds of people were pressed into service on Thursday to rescue 10 trapped coal mine workers in northern Mexico. The mine collapsed on Wednesday after the miners hit an adjacent area filled with water. While rescuers pumped out water, six special forces scuba divers were set to reach the site later in the day to enter the mine.

167.title: Shuttler Aakarshi reaches CWG pre-quarters after Pak opponent retires due to injury
167.article_body: Indian shuttler Aakarshi Kashyap has reached the women's singles pre-quarterfinals at CWG 2022 after emerging winner of her round of 32 match against Pakistan's Mahoor Shahzad. Aakarshi won the first game 22-20 and was leading 8-1 in the second when Mahoor retired due to an injury. PV Sindhu and Kidambi Srikanth also reached women's singles and men's singles pre-quarterfinals, respectively.

168.title: US, EU, Iran restart Tehran nuclear talks in Vienna
168.article_body: Representatives from Iran, the US and European Union restarted talks over Tehran's nuclear deal on Thursday, as reports claimed the Islamic Republic was expanding uranium enrichment. The Vienna talks are taking place amid growing skepticism, with the EU warning "space for additional significant compromises has been exhausted". The US is not directly communicating with Iran, but through the EU.

169.title: Canada sending military personnel to UK to train Ukrainians
169.article_body: Canadian Defence Minister Anita Anand said the country's military trainers are going to the UK to teach Ukrainians on how to defend against invading Russian forces. As per plans, 225 Canadian Armed Forces personnel will be based in the UK for at least four months. The Canadians will work alongside counterparts from Britain, New Zealand and the Netherlands.

170.title: Gandhi family's record is corrupt, Sonia & Rahul are out on bail: BJP
170.article_body: Amid the National Herald money laundering case, BJP national spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said on Thursday, "The Gandhi family’s track record is corrupt." "Three members of the family, Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and Robert Vadra, are out on bail," he added. He alleged that assets worth ₹2,000 crore of Associated Journals Limited were transferred to Young Indian.

171.title: Snakebite victim's brother visits UP for funeral, gets bitten by snake
171.article_body: A 22-year-old man named Govind Mishara travelled from Ludhiana to Uttar Pradesh's Bhawanipur village to attend the last rites of his brother who had died of snakebite on Tuesday. During his visit, Govind died after he himself got being bitten by a snake in his sleep. One of his relatives, who was in the same house, was also bitten.

172.title: Measures like scrapping Article 370 helped J&K's tourism sector: Reddy
172.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy on Thursday said Jammu and Kashmir reported "record footfall" of tourists in recent months because of "transformative initiatives" like abrogating Article 370. The comments came a day before the third anniversary of the revocation of Jammu and Kashmir's special status. Reddy said over 79 lakh tourists visited the state between October 2021 and March 2022.

173.title: 72-ft tricolour installed in Mussoorie for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
173.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) installed a 72-feet-tall national flag at ITBP Academy in Mussoorie, in association with Flag Foundation of India. The installation was done to spread awareness for the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign and is dedicated to the martyrs of the freedom struggle. The 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign is a part of the 76th Independence Day celebrations.

174.title: Johnny Depp drugged me the first time we had sex, claims his ex-girlfriend Ellen Barkin
174.article_body: Newly unsealed court documents reportedly reveal that Johnny Depp's ex-girlfriend, actress Ellen Barkin claimed he was "controlling", drank too much red wine and gave her a quaalude drug the first time they had sex. "He gave me a quaalude and asked...if I wanted to f**k," she was quoted as saying. Ellen was introduced as a witness by Amber Heard's team.

175.title: Fabrication Bazar raises ₹7 crore in a seed funding round
175.article_body: Fabrication Bazar, an engineering startup for manufacturing sectors, has raised ₹7 crore in a seed funding round.
