The round was led by Inflection Point Ventures, and the funds will be used to expand the team and scale operations to the export market. Founded in 2016 by Dwaipayan Dutta and Mohit Garg, Fabrication Bazar manufactures prefabricated steel products.

176.title: Reliance-backed logistics arm of Dunzo joins ONDC
176.article_body: Reliance-backed Dunzo for Business (D4B), the logistics arm of Dunzo, has joined the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) for last mile-delivery services. D4B said that the partnership will help local businesses. Dalvir Suri, D4B's head and Dunzo Co-founder said that they will start with key metros and later expand to other cities.

177.title: Do not overreact, no reason to escalate tensions: US to China over Pelosi's Taiwan visit
177.article_body: After China deployed planes and fired live missiles near Taiwan, the US urged China not to overreact to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. "There's no reason to react the way that they have or to escalate the tensions," White House national security spokesperson John Kirby said. "Bring down the tensions and work through this," he added.

178.title: Hardik Pandya visits former MI teammate Pollard's house in Caribbean, shares pics
178.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya visited his former MI teammate Kieron Pollard's house in the Caribbean. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "No trip to the Caribbean is complete without a visit to the King's home...Polly my favourite and your beautiful family, thank you for hosting me my brother." India are currently playing a five-match T20I series against West Indies.

179.title: 1 migrant labourer killed, 2 injured in grenade attack by terrorists in Pulwama
179.article_body: A migrant labourer died and two others were injured after terrorists hurled a grenade in Gadoora area of Pulwama in Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday. The area has been cordoned off and efforts have been launched to nab the terrorists, said Jammu and Kashmir Police. Both the injured labourers are now stable.

180.title: 73-year-old SP leader Azam Khan admitted to ICU with pneumonia
180.article_body: Senior Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan has been admitted to an ICU of Medanta hospital in Lucknow. The 73-year-old leader, who complained of breathlessness, was found suffering from pneumonia on Wednesday. "[He] has been kept under observation of a critical care team. His condition is stable," a doctor said. SP chief Akhilesh Yadav paid him a visit in the hospital.

181.title: Drugs, ₹2 cr cash recovered in J&K's Udhampur, 1 arrested
181.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police have recovered narcotics and cash in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur, officials said. The police have arrested one person in connection to the case and recovered 250 gm of heroin and cash of nearly ₹2 crore in different denominations. A case has been registered under relevant sections and an investigation has been initiated.

182.title: Video of Nikhat wishing her mother on b'day after assuring India of CWG medal goes viral
182.article_body: A video of Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen wishing her mother happy birthday after winning her quarter-final bout and assuring India of a medal at CWG 2022 has gone viral. In the video, Nikhat, who can be seen leaving the boxing ring, says, "Happy birthday ammi...I love you. Allah aapko khush rakhe." Nikhat's semi-final will take place on Saturday.

183.title: Lightning strikes kill 3 in separate incidents in Telangana
183.article_body: Three persons died in lightning strikes amid heavy rains in separate incidents in Telangana's Jayashankar Bhupalpally district. Vanga Ravi, a 48-year-old farmer, died in his farm in Ponugondla village and another farmer, 25-year-old Katam Raghupathi Reddy, was struck by lightning in  Shatrajpally village. Arepalli Varamma, a 56-year-old farmer, was struck by a lightning in Gopalapuram village.

184.title: Ranveer-Alia are this generation's SRK-Kajol: Karan Johar
184.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt are the present generation's Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol. "When Ranveer and Alia face the camera, you'll see...chemistry because they're buddies, they're friends," Karan said. "That friendship results in chemistry," he added. Alia and Ranveer will be next seen together in 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', helmed by Karan himself.

185.title: Security forces arrest three militants in J&K's Kupwara
185.article_body: In Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district, security forces arrested three militants and recovered arms and ammunition from their possession, the police said. The trio tried to flee a checkpoint at Fruit Mandi Crossing in Handwara, and were arrested, a police spokesperson said. Two of the arrested were identified as Manzoor Ahmed Kumar and Showkat Ahmed Bhat.

186.title: Life expectancy rose by 10 years in Africa from 2000 to 2019: WHO
186.article_body: Africa's healthy life expectancy rose by 10 years from the estimates of 2000 to 2019, the World Health Organization said on Thursday. This is the highest growth in life expectancy in any part of the world for this period. Life expectancy in Africa was 46 years in 2000 and in 2019 it was 56 years, according to WHO Africa.

187.title: NZ MPs urged to delete TikTok over fears China may access data
187.article_body: Members of the New Zealand Parliament have been urged to delete TikTok on their parliamentary phones as it poses a security risk, reports stated. "The parliamentary service strongly recommends you don't use TikTok on your parliamentary service devices as....data on your devices could be accessed by ByteDance [TikTok's owner] and the Chinese government," a parliamentary directive reportedly read.

188.title: Haryana Police arrest illegal arms manufacturer, seize country-made pistols
188.article_body: Haryana Police on Thursday arrested a man from Rajasthan's Bharatpur, who was allegedly involved in manufacturing and selling illegal weapons, a police spokesperson said. At least 48 country-made pistols, 17 cartridges and material used in making weapons were recovered from him. "Apart from making new weapons, he used to repair the old ones for a long time," the spokesperson added.

189.title: Delhi sees over 2,000 new COVID cases for 2nd straight day, positivity rate at 11.84%
189.article_body: Delhi reported 2,202 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday, compared to 2,073 cases recorded the previous day. The city also reported four deaths due to the infection, while the positivity rate rose to 11.84%. This is for the fourth day in a row that the national capital's COVID-19 positivity rate has crossed the 10% mark.

190.title: Ranveer Singh invited to pose nude again for PETA campaign
190.article_body: After Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot went viral, People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) India wrote a letter, inviting him to do a similar photoshoot for them. The organisation requested Ranveer to promote veganism through their campaign. It cited an example of Pamela Anderson, who earlier posed for PETA's 'All Animals Have the Same Parts - Try Vegan' campaign.

191.title: Gujarat leaders Raju Parmar, Naresh Raval quit Congress, to join BJP
191.article_body: Senior Congress leaders from Gujarat, Naresh Raval and Raju Parmar, resigned from the party on Thursday. "We'll join BJP...on August 17," Raval said, adding, "Many of our supporters will also join the BJP on that day." Further, Raval said that he has had many bitter experiences in Congress in the last ten years. This comes ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections.

192.title: Wife, mother of a lawyer shot dead by 4 persons in Haryana's Hansi
192.article_body: The wife and mother of a lawyer, Bunty Yadav, were shot dead on Thursday at his residence in Haryana's Hansi by four unidentified people, police said. The deceased have been identified as 27-year-old Supriya and 62-year-old Geeta Yadav, Bunty Yadav's wife and mother respectively. Bunty Yadav saved his life by locking himself in a room, police added.

193.title: 45 elephants killed in train accidents between 2019 & 2021: Govt
193.article_body: Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in a written reply to a Lok Sabha MP said that 45 elephants were killed in train accidents between 2019 and 2021. Providing statistics of deaths of elephants under different railway zones, Vaishnaw stated, in 2019, 10 elephants were killed and in 2020, 16 elephants died in collision with trains. In 2021,19 elephants were killed.

194.title: Brittney Griner found guilty on drug charges by Russian court, gets 9 years in prison
194.article_body: A Russian court has sentenced US basketball star Brittney Griner to nine years in prison after finding her guilty of deliberately bringing cannabis-infused vape cartridges into Russia despite them being illegal. This comes after a month-long trial and nearly six months after she was arrested at a Moscow-area airport. Griner's time served, since February, will be included in her term.

195.title: IFS officer shares pic of clouded leopard, calls it 'rare beauty'
195.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan took to Twitter to share a picture of a clouded leopard on the occasion of International Clouded Leopard Day. Calling clouded leopard a "rare beauty", Kaswan stated that the picture was taken at the Buxa Tiger Reserve. "Do you know where else we can find them in India?" he further asked his followers.

196.title: I read Irrfan's medical files & think 'Did I do something wrong?': Sutapa
196.article_body: Irrfan Khan's wife Sutapa said she hasn't been able to part ways with the actor's medical files even two years after his death. "I can't let those medical files go. Every night I...read them...thinking 'Did I do something wrong?'" Sutapa said. She said Irrfan was initially reluctant toward chemotherapy and wanted to live holistic life to deal with his illness.

197.title: Shiv Sena leader booked for using defamatory words against Maha CM
197.article_body: Kavita Gavand, a leader of Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction, has been booked for using defamatory language against Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde. According to police, Gavand used inappropriate words on Tuesday while supporters of Thackeray and Shinde clashed with each other over the installation of the photo frame of the CM and his son at Shiv Sena office in Dombivli.

198.title: We have ₹10 lakh cr proposals: Raj govt ahead of investment summit
198.article_body: The Rajasthan government on Thursday said it has arranged investment proposals worth over ₹10 lakh crore covering multiple sectors ahead of the 'Invest Rajasthan 2022’ Summit. Minister Shakuntala Rawat said around 3,000 delegates will attend the event and sessions will be held on start-ups, agriculture and future-ready sectors. The summit will be held on October 7 and 8 in Jaipur.

199.title: Ukraine’s situation not feasible for our students to go back: Govt
199.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said that Ukraine’s ground situation doesn’t permit the return of Indian students to the country. "We have been in touch with educational authorities in Ukraine…[They have] essentially reiterated [their] willingness to continue online courses,” the Centre told the Rajya Sabha. These students can appear in the Foreign Medical Graduate Examination, the government further said.

200.title: 300-year-old sculptures worth crores recovered from deceased smuggler's house in Chennai
200.article_body: Tamil Nadu Idol Wing CID recovered nine stolen sculptures from a house in Broadway in Chennai. The idols, believed to be nearly 300 years old, are estimated to be worth crores of rupees. The house belonged to Pamela Emanuel, wife of late Manuel Pineiro, who was reportedly an idol smuggler. Manuel's family didn't have proper documentation for statues, police said.

201.title: Nisha is dating a man who posed as his 'rakhi brother': Karan Mehra
201.article_body: Actor Karan Mehra has accused his estranged wife Nisha Rawal of having an extramarital affair with a man named Rohit Satia, who posed as her 'rakhi brother' and also performed her 'kanyadaan'. "He's staying at my house with Nisha," Karan said, adding that his son also stays with them, which is morally questionable. Karan claimed Rohit had "physically assaulted" him.

202.title: SEBI seeks clarification from Zomato over 'Eternal' restructuring
202.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has asked food delivery company Zomato to issue a clarification regarding the 'Eternal' restructuring scheme. CEO Deepinder Goyal in an internal memo said that the company will have multiple CEOs running the different businesses - Zomato, Blinkit, Hyperpure and Feeding India. He further added that the larger organisation would be called 'Eternal'.

203.title: It's fake, says Andhra MP as alleged nude video call with woman goes viral
203.article_body: YSRCP MP Gorantla Madhav has filed a complaint claiming that leaders of Telugu Desam Party (TDP) had morphed his face into a nude video to taint his image. The video, which he claims is "morphed", allegedly shows him having a video call with an unidentified woman. TDP leaders alleged that the MP had sexually harassed the woman in the video.

204.title: CBI raids Odisha businessman Mahimananda's office in ₹25 lakh bribe case
204.article_body: CBI raided the residence and office of Odisha businessman Mahimananda Mishra on Thursday in connection with a bribery case. As per reports, a senior official of Paradip Port Authority is accused of accepting over ₹25 lakh bribe to approve a project to be implemented at the port by Mishra's Odisha Stevedores Limited. Mishra is among the wealthiest persons in Odisha.

205.title: A-listers refused to work with me as I didn't compromise: Mallika Sherawat
205.article_body: Actress Mallika Sherawat said A-list actors refused to work with her as she wouldn't compromise. "If the hero calls you at 3 am and says, 'Come to my house', you have to go...if you are doing that film. If you don't go, you are out of the film," she told Bollywood Hungama. Mallika added she refused to "bow down".

206.title: 'Modishahi' reaching a new low: Cong on Kharge's summoning by ED
206.article_body: Congress on Thursday said that Mallikarjun Kharge's summoning by the ED during the working hours of Parliament was an "insult" to the legislature, alleging that "Modishahi" is reaching a new low. Congress's Digvijaya Singh said that the summoning of the Leader of Opposition in RS by a probe agency during Parliamentary proceedings had never happened in the history of democracy.

207.title: I've never liked living in Hollywood, it's frustrating: Sam Neill
207.article_body: Actor Sam Neill, who took a short break from acting and moved to his farm in New Zealand, said he doesn’t like to stay in Hollywood. “I really like working there...But it’s not a place where I want to live,” Neill said. “What I found frustrating about Hollywood...is that the only thing...people are interested in is...show business,” he said.

208.title: Jadeja deletes his viral comment on CSK's '10 years of Jaddu' tweet, sparks rift rumours
208.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has deleted his viral comment on CSK's '10 years of Jaddu' tweet that was posted by the franchise on February 4, sparking rumours of rift. Jadeja, who had joined the franchise in 2012, had commented, "10 more to go." Earlier, Jadeja had also deleted CSK-related posts from his Instagram account. However, CSK has constantly rubbished rift rumours.

209.title: Sonia, Rahul Gandhi not above law, Cong trying to spread anarchy: BJP
209.article_body: The BJP on Thursday accused Congress of trying to spread "anarchy" and "abusing and intimidating" the ED amid the Opposition party's protests against the agency's action against its leaders in the National Herald case. "Congress leaders are abusing and threatening the investigation agency. Sonia Gandhi and Rahul should know that they are not above the law," BJP's Gaurav Bhatia said.

210.title: UP couple who kidnapped 3-month-old baby arrested, infant rescued
210.article_body: A couple from Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr was arrested and the three-month-old baby they had kidnapped on Tuesday was rescued, police said on Thursday. The couple wanted to take the infant to Kolkata to sell it to a needy person. The woman is a Bangladeshi national, a habitual offender and has been married several times, said SSP Manjunath TC.

211.title: Judiciary should 'walk the talk': Mufti after journalist denied bail
211.article_body: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti on Thursday said the judiciary should "walk the talk", as journalist Siddique Kappan was denied bail by the Allahabad High Court. Siddique Kappan was once again denied bail and continues to be behind bars for covering the Hathras gang rape case, she said. Kappan has been booked under UAPA and on charges of sedition.

212.title: Maha ATS arrests Dawood Ibrahim's associate in terror funding case
212.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti Terrorism Squad has arrested an associate of fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim in a terror funding case. Parvez Zuber Vaid Memon, who is allegedly involved in "anti-national activities", was picked up from his home in suburban Versova, an official said. The FIR in the matter has also named Dawood's younger brother Anees Ibrahim.

213.title: Over 4,000 cattle die of lumpy skin disease in Rajasthan
213.article_body: Over 4,000 animals, mostly cows, have been killed and another 90,000 were infected by the lumpy skin disease in Rajasthan. Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday appealed to herders to contact veterinary centres if they see signs of the viral disease. "The infection has spread to 16 districts. Barmer, Jodhpur and Jalore are the worst affected," said a senior official.

214.title: Guj doctor fakes kidnapping to exact ₹15 lakh from father to pay gambling debt
214.article_body: A 33-year-old doctor was detained in Ahmedabad on Wednesday for allegedly faking a kidnapping to exact ₹15 lakh in ransom from his father and clear debts he incurred through online gambling. The doctor had also borrowed ₹26.5 lakh from friends after losing money through online gambling. He drove around Ahmedabad in his car while calling his father with ransom demands.

215.title: Fire breaks out in Berlin forest after blast at bomb disposal site
215.article_body: An explosion at a police munitions detonation site in Berlin started a forest fire in the German capital's Grunewald area on Thursday. Officials said there was possibility of more explosions and flying debris from the site. Firefighting efforts were impeded as personnel were forced to maintain a safety distance of 1 km from the flames.

216.title: Actress Upasana Singh sues Harnaaz Sandhu for allegedly breaching film contract
216.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu, who's set to make her debut in the entertainment industry with Punjabi film 'Bai Ji Kuttange', has been sued by actress-producer Upasana Singh for allegedly not honouring a contract. Upasana claimed that Harnaaz has refused to give dates for the film's promotion despite having signed agreement to make herself available in person and virtually for it.

217.title: Iranian satellite to be launched into orbit by Russian space agency
217.article_body: Russia will place an Iranian remote sensing satellite into orbit on August 9, the Roscosmos space agency said on Wednesday. The announcement of the launch comes weeks after Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to Iran, during which he met Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi and the country's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. Notably, both Russia and Iran are under US sanctions.

218.title: India beat Wales 4-1, reach men's hockey semi-finals at CWG for 4th consecutive time
218.article_body: India defeated Wales 4-1 in their final men's hockey group match to advance to the semi-finals at CWG 2022. India topped Pool B with three victories and a draw. It is the fourth consecutive time that India have reached the men's hockey semi-finals at CWG. Harmanpreet Singh netted a hat-trick in India's 4-1 victory over Wales.

219.title: Bihar SP gets show-cause notice for not producing accused in court in 42-yr-old case
219.article_body: A Bihar sessions court issued Rohtas police superintendent Ashish Bharti a show-cause notice for not producing an accused in a 42-year-old murder case. Calling the offence a serious negligence, Judge Manoj Kumar, asked Bharti to appear in court. However, instead of Bharti, Deputy police superintendent Saroj Kumar Sah appeared in court and pleaded that there was no negligence knowingly.

220.title: Parents should monitor the subjects children are taught in madrasas: Assam CM
220.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said that parents should keep a watch on what subjects their children are being taught in madrasas. The Jamiul Huda Madrasa in Moirabari was demolished today for links to a Bangladesh-based terror outfit. The CM said, "We have already abolished 800 government madrasas in Assam. But there are many Qawmi madrasas in the state."

221.title: Drug peddler hit by truck while escaping from police in J&K, aide held
221.article_body: A drug peddler was run over by a speeding truck along the Jammu-Srinagar national highway in Udhampur district on Wednesday while he was escaping from the police. His associate, Jagtar Singh, was arrested and ₹1.91 crore cash and 250 grams heroin were seized. "The money appeared to be part of the proceeds of an earlier consignment of narcotics," police said.

222.title: Parts of Great Barrier Reef show highest coral cover in 36 yrs: Report
222.article_body: Parts of Australia's Great Barrier Reef recently showed the highest coral cover in 36 years, scientists said. According to the Australian Institute of Marine Science (AIMS), the average hard coral cover in northern and central regions increased to 36% and 33% in 2021, respectively. Experts, however, warned any recovery could be reversed as coral bleaching continues due to global warming.

223.title: Man beats up 2 stray dogs with stick, Pune Police launches probe
223.article_body: The Pune City Police are probing a case in which two stray dogs were severely beaten with a wooden stick in the Wagholi area on July 22. The incident was brought to the notice of the police by an animal welfare activist. The complainant said that the medical examination of the two dogs revealed severe injuries.

224.title: Constitutional investigative agencies are like toys for BJP: Tejashwi
224.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Thursday criticised central investigative agencies and said they are like toys for the BJP. "Be it ED, CBI, IT, they unfortunately work as BJP's cells," Yadav said. "It's saddening that all such agencies are working under such tremendous pressure that even fair probe cannot be done," Yadav added.

225.title: Social media platforms creating new challenges for child safety: NCPCR
225.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) said social media platforms are posing new challenges to child safety. "Children are being manipulated on social media platforms, technically known as grooming and these agencies are not ready to cooperate," NCPCR chairperson said. NCPCR claimed these platforms remain ignorant over issues like grooming, phishing and cyber-bullying.

226.title: Which 5 boxers have assured India of medals so far at CWG 2022?
226.article_body: As many as five Indian boxers have reached the semi-finals of their respective categories at CWG 2022, assuring India of medals. Nitu Ghanghas, 21, reached the semi-final of women's minimumweight category, while Mohammad Hussamuddin has reached semi-final of men's featherweight category. Nikhat Zareen, Amit Panghal and Jaismine have also reached the semi-finals of their respective categories.

227.title: 3-yr-old boy found sleeping next to dead mother at railway station in Bihar, pic surfaces
227.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was found dead on a platform of Bihar's Bhagalpur railway station with her 3-year-old boy sleeping next to her, unaware of her demise. The specially-abled child was rescued and handed over to child welfare committee. The woman's body was kept in the mortuary for identification and when her identity couldn't be ascertained, her last rites were performed.

228.title: Who is Romita Shetty, the Indian-origin businesswoman who funded Imran Khan's PTI party?
228.article_body: Pakistan's election commission issued show-cause notice to ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan's PTI party for receiving prohibited funding from foreign nationals, including Indian-origin businesswoman Romita Shetty. Romita is US-based DiMaio Ahmad Capital's MD. She did BA from Delhi's St Stephen's College and Masters from Columbia University. She's the wife of Pakistani-American businessman Nasir Ahmed.

229.title: Govt to conduct compliance audits of social media firms every quarter: Report
229.article_body: Electronics and Information Technology Ministry has decided to conduct compliance audits of social media firms every quarter, PTI reported. Through the audits, the government will reportedly verify if social media companies are reporting about grievances raised by them correctly and if their action taken is in sync with laid out rules. An appellate panel will also reportedly be set up.

230.title: Crypto worth $2 billion stolen from cross-chain bridges in 2022: Report
230.article_body: Cross-chain bridge attacks led to theft of crypto worth $2 billion in 2022 and were responsible for 69% of all crypto losses, according to a report by Chainalysis. The report noted that 13 different token bridge breaches have occurred this year, with the last one being the Nomad Bridge flaw. The January-March quarter witnessed the largest crypto stolen since 2021.

231.title: Scientists successfully revive dead pigs' organs using new technology
231.article_body: Scientists have developed a technology to restore blood circulation and other cell functions in pigs an hour after their death. The technique delivers a specially designed cell-protective fluid to organs and tissues that delay cellular degradation of transplantable organs like heart, liver and kidneys for hours after death. Scientists believe the findings can make more organ transplants possible.

232.title: Autorickshaw driver using his 1st ATM card cheated of ₹34,000 near Mumbai
232.article_body: An autorickshaw driver was cheated at an ATM kiosk in Mira Road near Mumbai on Tuesday. Sushil Sharma had gone to generate a PIN for his first ATM card when a scammer stepped in to help him with the process. He stealthily replaced Sharma's card and later used it and the memorised PIN to withdraw ₹34,000 from Sharma's bank account.

233.title: Video shows sea cucumber eating with tentacle-like structures, Twitter user says 'scary'
233.article_body: Indian Forest Service officer Susanta Nanda has shared a clip of a sea cucumber eating its food. The clip shows the creature being released completely and seconds later, it shows the sea cucumber using its tentacle-like structures to eat. "Scary stuff," a Twitter user commented while another person wrote, "Wonders of nature."

234.title: Shankar has been making pan India films for 30 yrs: Suriya
234.article_body: Praising Tamil filmmaker Shankar for his contribution to Indian cinema, actor Suriya said, "Shankar...showed us what it is to make pan-India films long back. He's been doing it for 30 years." Suriya further said, "The anticipation around his films has been always there. Even now, entire India is looking forward to 'Indian 2' and his next film with Ram Charan."

235.title: E-cigarettes worth ₹15 lakh seized in Hyderabad, 3 arrested
235.article_body: The Hyderabad Commissioner's Task Force (south) on Wednesday arrested three persons from Punjagutta and seized e-cigarettes worth ₹15 lakh from them. Preliminary investigation revealed that the primary accused had stocked e-cigarettes at his residence in Jeedimetla, police said. The accused used to reach out to customers through marketing on Instagram, police added.

236.title: Norway envoy asked to leave Russia after saying 'I hate Russians'
236.article_body: Moscow on Thursday said that a Norwegian diplomat can't stay in Russia after she was filmed uttering "Russophobic remarks" during an outburst at a hotel reception in Murmansk. "I hate Russians...Just give me a room...I'm used to clean rooms, I'm from Scandinavia," Elisabeth Ellingsen, the diplomat, was recorded as saying. Norwegian Foreign Ministry said that it "deeply regretted" the incident.

237.title: OnePlus launches OnePlus 10T 5G starting at ₹49,999
237.article_body: OnePlus has launched the new OnePlus 10T 5G in India. The smartphone offers the latest Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 processor with 150W fast charging, promising a full charge in 19 minutes, 6.7-inch full HD+ display, Android 12-based OxygenOS 12.1, and more. Available for sale on August 6, it comes in Jade Green and Moonstone Black colour variants starting at ₹49,999.

238.title: Want to work in films with understanding of gender dynamics: Arjun Kapoor
238.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor expressed his wish to work in films with an understanding of gender dynamics. "There's a gender bias created subconsciously in our upbringing. It's up to artistes to break it by doing films...they can ideologically stand by," he said. "I come from a deep-rooted understanding of gender dynamics and want to submit to such stories," he added.

239.title: School bus rams into truck in Mumbai; no casualties reported
239.article_body: A bus of St Mary's School crashed into a truck on Thursday morning in Agripada, Mumbai. The accident occurred after the bus driver was unable to brake while driving on the metal sheets which have been used to cover the road due to some metro work. No casualties were reported as there were no children on board during the accident.

240.title: GHMC collects nearly ₹1,000 crore property tax in 4 months
240.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has collected nearly ₹1,000 crore in property tax in the last four months. The civic body collected ₹997.50 crore by Wednesday, with the revenue being generated from April 1 to August 3. Out of the 9.64 lakh assessments, over 6 lakh property owners paid tax online, a GHMC official said.

241.title: Gujarat teacher hangs self after rape complaint registered against him
241.article_body: A teacher in Gujarat's Chhotaudepur allegedly died by suicide by hanging himself at his home after the mother of a 14-year-old mute and differently-abled girl registered a rape complaint against him. The mother alleged that the teacher had raped her daughter when she was alone at home. The teacher was absconding since the complaint was registered last week.

242.title: Sikh body approves Aamir Khan’s look & character in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'
242.article_body: The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee gave its nod to Aamir Khan starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', in which the actor plays a Sikh character. Aamir will be seen donning a beard and turban in the movie, set in Punjab. "I was very touched by the reaction of [SGPC] members...I'm so glad that our film touched their hearts so deeply," Aamir said.

243.title: Seems like a pat on his back: HC on Baba Ramdev's Coronil clarification
243.article_body: Delhi HC said Baba Ramdev's clarification on Coronil "seems to be more like a pat" on his back and granted him another opportunity to present an "appropriate" draft clarification. The HC was hearing a suit filed by a group of doctors' associations over Ramdev's statements against allopathy during the COVID-19 pandemic. Ramdev had claimed Coronil is the cure against COVID-19.

244.title: Sri Lanka is committed to 'One China' policy: Prez Wickremesinghe
244.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Thursday reaffirmed Sri Lanka's commitment to the 'One China' policy. Countries must refrain from provocations that escalate global tensions, Wickremesinghe said after meeting China's Ambassador to Sri Lanka Qi Zhenhong. His remarks come after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi concluded her visit to Taiwan, over which China had warned US of consequences.

245.title: Vote without fear: Alva tells MPs ahead of Vice Presidential polls
245.article_body: Opposition's Vice Presidential candidate Margaret Alva on Thursday urged members of the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha to cast their votes for their preferred candidate without fear in the upcoming Vice Presidential elections. "The VP election on August 6 is not subject to party whip and is by secret ballot...MPs are expected to vote without...political pressure," she said.

246.title: Pune autorickshaw unions to go on strike as CNG price rises by ₹6/kg
246.article_body: Autorickshaw unions in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad areas have decided to go on a half-day strike on August 9. They also plan to hold protests outside MP Girish Bapat's office. This comes after the price of compressed natural gas (CNG) increased by ₹6 per kg in Pune. The unions are also demanding to revise the auto fare as per new rates.

247.title: Toilet commode collapses in Thane, injures 22-yr-old pregnant woman
247.article_body: A 22-year-old pregnant woman was injured after the commode of a public toilet collapsed in the Kalyan-Dombivali area of Thane district on Thursday morning, a civic official said. "The commode collapsed into the septic tank. The woman tried to come out of the tank but finally was pulled out by others who heard her cries," the official added.

248.title: Raid at another Kolkata flat linked to Partha Chatterjee, Arpita Mukherjee
248.article_body: The ED is conducting a search at an apartment in South Kolkata today, linked to the teacher recruitment scam, in which Partha Chatterjee and his aide, Arpita Mukherjee, have been arrested. A locksmith was called in as the apartment at the Fort Oasis complex was locked. Since the arrests in July, the ED has recovered around ₹50 core in cash.

249.title: Mysterious loud sound heard across Punjab's Ludhiana twice today
249.article_body: A mysterious loud sound was heard across Punjab's Ludhiana at least twice today, with locals wondering what it was. Several locals suspected it to be a sonic boom. One of the residents wrote on social media, "The building trembled a little bit too." Another wrote, "It was like something big hit my house roof."

250.title: 2 minor girl inmates escape from state-run home in Kerala, traced
250.article_body: Two minor girl inmates of the state-run Nirbhaya Home in Kerala's Kozhikode allegedly escaped in the early hours of Thursday. Police sources said the two were traced from a nearby area and brought back to the shelter by 11 AM. Six girls, including two sisters, had reportedly escaped from the children's home, housed in the same compound, in late January.

251.title: Bengaluru-based company's ₹40.14 cr assets attached in money laundering probe
251.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has provisionally attached the assets of Bengaluru-based Kavveri Telecom Infrastructure Limited worth ₹40.14 crore under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002. The ED initiated probe based on an FIR filed by the CBI in 2017. A former deputy general manager of Dena Bank has accused the company's directors of cheating with regard to bank loans.

252.title: More than 10,000 startups registered in 2022: Piyush Goyal
252.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal announced that India has over 75,000 startups. The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), in a press release, said that the latest 10,000 startups were registered in the last 156 days. It took 808 days for the first 10,000 startups to be registered in India.

253.title: 4 teenage boys drown in a water-filled quarry in MP's Mandsaur
253.article_body: Four teenage boys drowned in a water-filled quarry in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur district on Wednesday afternoon, police said. The deceased, aged around 16-17 years, were on their way to a coaching class, but changed plans and decided to step into the quarry filled with rainwater, police said. The boys tried to alert passers-by, but drowned by the time help arrived.

254.title: Dabur Q1 net profit rises at ₹441 crore, revenue jumps 8.07%
254.article_body: Dabur India Limited on Thursday reported a marginal increase in consolidated net profit at ₹441.06 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹438.30 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The FMCG major's revenue from operations was up 8.07% to ₹2,822.43 crore. The shares of Dabur India closed at ₹573.95 at the National Stock Exchange.

255.title: 16-year-old 'possessed' girl beheads 7-year-old niece in Raj
255.article_body: A 16-year-old girl beheaded her 7-year-old niece under the influence of the "possession" of a supernatural entity, reports said. According to her family members, the girl's voice and behaviour changed during a ritualistic procedure in the house. She started screaming and suddenly picked up a sword and beheaded her niece, the family members added.

256.title: 56 Kanwariyas injured after bus rams into truck in Bihar's Gopalganj
256.article_body: As many as 56 Kanwariyas reportedly sustained injuries on Thursday after their bus collided with a stationary truck in Bihar's Gopalganj district. The accident occurred when a tanker took a steep turn while overtaking the bus, making the driver lose control of bus. The devotees were on their way to Jharkhand's Deoghar to offer Ganga Jal on the 'Shiva Ling'.

257.title: Bank of England raises interest rate to 1.75% in biggest increase in 27 years
257.article_body: The Bank of England has raised interest rates by 0.5 percentage points to 1.75% in the biggest increase in 27 years. The base rate has been raised for the sixth consecutive time. UK's inflation had increased to 9.4% in June. The cost-of-living crisis will continue throughout next year and only begin to ease in 2024, the bank's forecast read.

258.title: Saddened & shocked: 'Batgirl' directors as the movie gets shelved
258.article_body: A day after the news broke that 'Batgirl' will not be released either theatrically or on HBO Max, directors of the film, Adil El Arbi and Bilall Fallah, said they are shocked and saddened by the news. "As directors, it's critical that our work be shown to audiences...we wish...fans...would have had the opportunity to see...the final film," they stated.

259.title: Google removed over 1.11 lakh harmful content pieces in India in June
259.article_body: Google removed 1,11,493 harmful pieces of content in June in accordance with the new India IT Rules, 2021. According to Mashable, a majority of the content was removed due to copyright infringement, with the rest of the removed content falling under categories like trademarks, court orders, explicit sexual material, among others. Google received 32,717 complaints about external content in June.

260.title: B'luru woman alleges rape by 8 men in church 12 years ago, files FIR
260.article_body: A 21-year-old girl from Bengaluru filed an FIR after 12 years in the Shivaji Nagar Police Station that eight people had raped her in a church when she was ten years old. The woman revealed that after having been sexually assaulted by the two accused, she went to the secretary of Antioch House of Worship, who also assaulted her.

261.title: A disgrace: Bangladesh's Team Director on T20I series loss vs Zimbabwe
261.article_body: Bangladesh's Team Director Khaled Mahmud termed his team's T20I series loss against Zimbabwe as a "disgrace", adding that losing was "quite unusual". "Nobody even tried to hit a six...They batted like [they were] trying to protect their place," stated Mahmud. "If you can't pull a short ball for six, that's going to be a problem...I am very disappointed," he said.

262.title: Tencent seeks to raise stake in 'Assassin's Creed' maker Ubisoft: Report
262.article_body: Tencent plans to raise its stake in French video game maker Ubisoft, Reuters reported. Tencent, which bought a 5% stake in Ubisoft in 2018, has reached out to the French firm's founding Guillemot family and expressed interest in increasing its stake in the firm. Tencent reportedly aims to become the single largest shareholder of Ubisoft with the additional stake purchase.

263.title: Probing claims of Sikh migrants' turbans being seized at Mexico border: US
263.article_body: US authorities are investigating claims that turbans of nearly 50 Sikh migrants were seized after they were detained along the country's border with Mexico, reports stated. "We take allegations of this nature very seriously," Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Commissioner Chris Magnus reportedly said. "Our expectation is that CBP employees treat all migrants...with respect," Magnus added.

264.title: Gold prices in India rise, trade at ₹51,815 per 10 gram
264.article_body: Following positive global cues, gold prices in India traded higher on Thursday at ₹51,815 per 10 gram. Gold October futures traded higher by ₹461 at ₹51,850 per 10 gram on the Multi Commodity Exchange. Silver September futures rose ₹57,880 per kg. A pullback in the US dollar and Treasury yields led gold prices to edge higher globally.

265.title: To have a child at 29 is Alia's coolest, bravest decision: Kareena
265.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has lauded Alia Bhatt's decision of embracing motherhood at the age of 29. "I think it's the bravest and coolest decision for Alia," Kareena said. "She...stood up for the most beautiful [feeling], which is, 'I want to have a child with the man I love'," Kareena added. Alia Bhatt announced her pregnancy in June 2022.

266.title: Never wished to be an actor, wanted to become an IAS officer: Annu Kapoor
266.article_body: Actor Annu Kapoor, who has been working in the entertainment industry for over four decades, said he never wished to be an actor and wanted to become an IAS officer instead. He told HT that his parents did not have the financial background to support his dreams. Hence, he ended up joining his father's theatre company to support his family.

267.title: Govt doesn't interfere in workings of law agencies in country: Union Minister
267.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday told Rajya Sabha that Centre doesn't interfere in the workings of law agencies in the country. His statement came after Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge raised a question regarding his ED summon, saying, "Is it suitable for ED to summon me while Parliament session is ongoing?" This was being done to demoralise Opposition, he added.

268.title: Horrible 'raj' going on in country: Cong MP on ED summon to Kharge
268.article_body: Reacting to the ED summon sent to Congress’ Mallikarjun Kharge, party MP KC Venugopal said that horrible "raj" is going on in the country. "There are parliamentary systems. We are law-abiding citizens but when the Parliament is in session and LoP (Kharge) is participating in a debate, ED is summoning him at 12:30 [pm]. What is the point?" Venugopal asked.

269.title: He had no work at Hathras: HC as it rejects bail plea of journalist Siddique
269.article_body: Allahabad High Court has rejected the bail plea of journalist Siddique Kappan, who was booked under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. Kappan was arrested in 2020 when he was on his way to meet the Hathras gang-rape victim's family. Denying him bail, the court said, "[He] had no work at Hathras." Police had accused him of intending to create communal disharmony.

270.title: USFDA gives approval to Zydus Lifesciences to market skin cream
270.article_body: The US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) has given Zydus Lifesciences Limited the approval to market its generic version of the Ivermectin cream used to treat inflammatory skin disease. Inflammatory lesions of rosacea is a common skin condition that causes redness of the skin and small bumps on the face. The cream will be manufactured at Zydus Lifesciences' Ahmedabad facility.

271.title: IndiGo to let passengers disembark from three doors of aircraft
271.article_body: IndiGo airline on Thursday said that it will start a three-point disembarkation process allowing passengers to deboard the aircraft faster upon arrival at the airport. The disembarkation process will be carried out from two forward and one rear exit ramp. Initially, this will be implemented at Delhi, Mumbai and Bengaluru airports on IndiGo's A320 and A321 fleet, the airline said.

272.title: Himachal Pradesh BJP vice-president Praveen Sharma passes away aged 65
272.article_body: Himachal Pradesh BJP vice-president Praveen Sharma died on Thursday morning aged 65. Sharma, who was the vice chairman of Himachal Pradesh Housing and Urban Development Authority (HIMUDA), died at his residence in Amb town. He was elected from the Amb Assembly constituency in 1998 and had also served as Excise and Taxation-cum-Youth Welfare and Sports Minister.

273.title: Rejected OTT shows due to abusive words, sexual content: Kiran Karmarkar
273.article_body: Actor Kiran Karmarkar, known for portraying 'Om Agarwal' in 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii', said he was offered several shows for OTT platforms, but they didn't work. "I didn't like the content of some shows. Also, in some of them, I found...sexual content and abusive words that were used very [unnecessarily]," he added. The actor will be next seen in 'Darlings'.

274.title: We look up to Mirabai for inspiration: Pak weightlifter who lifted 405 kg to win CWG gold
274.article_body: Pakistani weightlifter Muhammad Nooh Dastgir Butt, who lifted a total of 405 kg to win gold in men's 109+ kg category at CWG 2022, said it was a proud moment for him when Mirabai Chanu congratulated him. "We look up to Mirabai for inspiration," he added. "She has shown us...we from...South Asian countries can also win...Olympic medal," he stated.

275.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Raksha Bandhan' gets rare ‘U’ certificate
275.article_body: The Censor Board has cleared Akshay Kumar starrer 'Raksha Bandhan' with a 'U' certificate. Films are usually given a 'U/A' certificate, where viewing for children below 12 years requires parental guidance, but for 'U' certificate movies, viewing is completely unrestricted. "For me, [it's]...a personal victory. I got down to making a clean family entertainer," director Aanand L Rai said.

276.title: Bharti Airtel to roll out 5G services this month, signs equipment deals
276.article_body: Bharti Airtel has signed 5G equipment service deals with Ericsson, Nokia and Samsung, and will start rolling out 5G services later this month, the telecom operator said. Bharti Airtel acquired 19,867.8 MHz spectrum worth ₹43,084 crore in the country's first-ever 5G spectrum auction. "Airtel will work with the best technology partners from across the world," its MD and CEO said.

277.title: ISRO provides aid of ₹50 lakh each to six startups for R&D
277.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) provided financial aid of ₹50 lakh each to six startups, Minister of State of Science & Technology said in a written reply in the Lok Sabha. The aid was provided for research and development under the ANIC-ARISE 1.0 programme announced in 2020. The Minister added that 24 startups applied of which six were selected.

278.title: 22-year-old COVID positive burglar escapes from hospital in Mumbai
278.article_body: A 22-year-old burglar, Nazim Ayub Khan, allegedly escaped from Mumbai's Kasturba Hospital as he was admitted there after testing positive for COVID-19. Khan was arrested on July 30 and tested positive for COVID-19 during a mandatory check, police said. "We've checked the CCTV footage in which the accused can be seen running through the back door," police added.

279.title: 32-yr-old carpenter loses ₹2.98 lakh to cyber fraud in Navi Mumbai
279.article_body: A 32-year-old carpenter in Navi Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹2.98 lakh while trying to know why ₹1,100 was debited from his bank account. The complainant searched for a customer care number and called a toll-free number. However, the call was disconnected and he received a call from the fraudster, who asked him to install an app and cheated him.

280.title: Tejaswin, who won historic CWG medal for India, fought court case to feature in CWG
280.article_body: High jumper Tejaswin Shankar, who became the first-ever Indian to win a medal in high jump in CWG history, had fought a court case to be included in CWG. He wasn't included initially despite achieving the qualification mark. He moved Delhi High Court against Athletics Federation of India (AFI), who later included him as a replacement for Arokia Rajiv.

281.title: ED kept me in a room without windows and ventilation: Sanjay Raut to court
281.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, who was arrested in a money laundering case, told a court the ED kept him in a room without windows and ventilation. The ED said there was no window because he was kept in an AC room but Raut said he cannot use AC. The ED then assured he'd be kept in a ventilated room.

282.title: It'll displace the market: Hogg on IPL sides buying teams in T20 leagues
282.article_body: Reacting to IPL franchises purchasing teams in global T20 leagues, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said, "It's going to displace the marketplace in certain phases." "You lose track of who actually is in your franchise," added Hogg. Former Australian cricketer Adam Gilchrist had earlier stated that he is concerned about IPL's monopolisation of global T20 leagues, terming it "dangerous".

283.title: Assam is becoming hotbed of 'jihadi activities': Assam CM Sarma
283.article_body: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday said that Assam has become a hotbed of "jihadi activities", with five modules having links with Bangladesh-based terror outfit Ansarul Islam busted in five months. Indoctrination of Muslim youths in private madrasas by Imams from outside the state is alarming, he said. "Jihadi activity is very different from terrorist or insurgency activities," Sarma added.

284.title: ED summons Sanjay Raut's wife Varsha Raut in Patra Chawl money laundering case
284.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday summoned Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's wife Varsha Raut in connection with the Patra Chawl money laundering case. The summons was issued after transactions done on her account came to light, ED said. The law enforcement agency claimed that an amount worth ₹1.08 crore was received in the account of Varsha from unrelated persons.

285.title: Facebook to remove live shopping from Oct 1 and focus on Reels
285.article_body: Social media giant Facebook has decided to shut live shopping feature from October 1. Facebook said that it will focus on Reels for its main application and Instagram because consumers' viewing behaviours are shifting towards short-form videos. Users will be able to broadcast events on Facebook Live but they will not be able to tag products or create product playlists.

286.title: Reservation list for BBMP polls released; 81 seats for OBCs
286.article_body: The BBMP has released the reservation list for Scheduled Tribes (STs), Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Other Backward Classes (OBCs) for the upcoming elections to the civic body. As per the draft notification, 81 seats were reserved for OBCs, 28 for SCs and four for STs. Of all 243 seats, 50% have been reserved for women candidates in each category.

287.title: 3 of migrant workers' family from MP found dead in house in Telangana
287.article_body: At least three members of a family of migrant workers from Madhya Pradesh were found dead in a house in Telangana's Sangareddy district, police said. The deceased include a 28-year-old woman, her two-year-old daughter and her husband's 27-year-old cousin, police added. The woman and the 27-year-old man were in an intimate relationship, police further said.

288.title: Rejected international projects to prioritise my family: Anil Kapoor
288.article_body: Anil Kapoor revealed in an interview that he was offered many international shows, however, he rejected them to prioritise his family. "Sometimes, shows need a lot of your time. Then you have to make...choice," the actor added. He further said that he takes his family's consent if it's a big project. "If they say yes, I do it," he added.

289.title: US-based Product10x plans to enter India to help startups raise funds
289.article_body: US-based company Product10x is planning to enter India this year with an aim to help pre-seed, seed and Series A startups scale up and raise funds. Product10x is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) focused accelerator which has helped startups secure over $10 million funding in past three years. It has 16 companies in its portfolio out of which two are in India.

290.title: Adani Wilmar's Q1 net profit rises by 10% due to higher sales
290.article_body: Adani Wilmar Limited on Wednesday reported a 10% growth in consolidated net profit to ₹193.59 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹175.70 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The company attributed the growth to higher sales. MD and CEO Angshu Mallick said the company witnessed double-digit growth in sales through e-commerce and modern trade.

291.title: Sanjay Raut will never do any corruption, BJP is scared of him: Sunil Raut
291.article_body: After a Mumbai court extended ED custody of Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut till August 8, his brother Sunil Raut said BJP is scared of Sanjay. "We have faith in judiciary…Sanjay Raut is a true Shiv Sainik of Balasaheb Thackeray, he will never do any corruption," Sunil added. The Shiv Sena leader has been arrested in Patra Chawl money-laundering case.

292.title: Pune woman harassed for rejecting man's proposal on matrimonial site
292.article_body: Pune Police have launched a probe to find a man accused of sexually harassing a 29-year-old woman after she rejected his proposal on a matrimonial site. The accused, who is a resident of Mumbai, allegedly demanded sexual favours from the woman and sent defamatory messages to her relatives and friends online after she rejected his proposal, police said.

293.title: Jason Momoa turns flight attendant, hands out water aboard Hawaii flight
293.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa turned into a flight attendant and surprised passengers aboard a flight in Hawaii on Tuesday. A video showing Jason pushing the snack cart and handing out water bottles to the passengers has gone viral on social media. The water bottles, however, belonged to a brand, created by Jason himself. "His marketing team is genius," a user commented.

294.title: Anushka to undergo cricket training in UK's Leeds for 'Chakda Xpress'
294.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma will reportedly undergo cricket training in Leeds, UK, from mid-August to prepare herself thoroughly before shooting intensive cricket portions of 'Chakda Xpress'. Anushka will portray the role of women cricket's all-time greatest fast bowler Jhulan Goswami in the film. "She is leaving no stone unturned to become Jhulan on screen," a source, as quoted by Pinkvilla, said.

295.title: Samsung scales back production in Vietnam as demand falls: Reports
295.article_body: Samsung Electronics has cut down production at a smartphone plant in Vietnam as retailers and warehouses deal with increasing inventory amid global fall in consumer spending, reports said. US retailers like Best Buy, Target Corp warn of slowing sales. Plant workers said they are shifting to three-day and four-day work week as six-day work week and overtime is not needed.

296.title: 2 doctors booked for death of woman, baby after C-section in Mumbai
296.article_body: Two doctors have been booked for the death of a woman and her newborn baby following a  botched C-section at a civic-run hospital in Mumbai's Ghatkopar in 2016. Dr Megha Dharmdasari and Dr Prabjyot Manchanda, accused of lapses during the Caesarean procedure, have been booked for causing death by negligence and common intention. "The doctors...were residential medical officers," police said.

297.title: Hope something works out: Naga Chaitanya on his meeting with Bhansali
297.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who was recently spotted at filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's office, said he was there for "just casual meetings", adding that he hopes "something works out". "These are filmmakers I have looked up to, so just [paying] respects," he stated. Chaitanya will soon make his Hindi film debut with 'Laal Singh Chaddha' alongside Aamir Khan.

298.title: Lenovo, Acer, Motorola to face probe over alleged patent violation
298.article_body: The US International Trade Commission said that it will investigate companies including Lenovo, Motorola and Acer over a complaint of violation of a US law. The companies have been accused of selling certain video devices and products that violate patents. The tech firms could be blocked from importing certain gadgets if the ITC confirms infringement of four patents.

299.title: We’ll take all account of loot in Delhi, H’yana: Khattar on National Herald case
299.article_body: Commenting on the National Herald case, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that Congress has already "looted" Haryana. "We are going to take all the account of this loot from them here (in Delhi) and in Haryana as well," CM Khattar added. The ED on Wednesday sealed the Congress-owned National Herald office.

300.title: Venture capital firm AWE Funds launches India fund worth ₹350 crore
300.article_body: To promote gender equity, gender-focused venture capital firm Achieving Women Equity (AWE) Funds has launched a maiden fund for India for ₹350 crore. The US-based fund is looking to invest in 15 startups across healthcare, climate and sustainability, food and agri, education, and fintech sectors over the next five years. AWE claims to have invested ₹2,800 crore, to date.

301.title: 2 members of 'Namaste gang' arrested after encounter with police in Delhi
301.article_body: Two members of the 'Namaste gang' have been arrested following a brief encounter in Delhi's Shahdara area, police said on Thursday. The gang's members used to greet victims with 'namaste' before and after looting them. Police had set a trap to catch the criminals when they opened fire, with one policeman surviving a narrow escape due to his bulletproof jacket.

302.title: Free entry at Charminar, Golconda Fort in Hyderabad from August 5 to15
302.article_body: Monuments protected by the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) will have free entry for all visitors from August 5 to 15. This comes amid the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' to celebrate 75 years of independence of India. The ASI sites in Hyderabad and Warangal that will have free entry include Archaeological Site Museum, Kondapur, Charminar, Golconda Fort and Warangal Fort.

303.title: 2 men pose as pilots to obtain US visa, booked by Delhi Police
303.article_body: The Delhi Police have registered a case against a 19-year-old man and his father for allegedly posing as pilots and forging documents to obtain US visas. During an interview with the US Embassy officials, Keshav (19-year-old accused) confessed he had lied about his pilot training certificate, adding that his DGCA exam reports and financial documents were all fake, police said.

304.title: US-based Paystand, Mexico's Yaydoo merge to make blockchain platform
304.article_body: US-based Paystand and Mexico-based Yaydoo on Wednesday announced a merger to facilitate a blockchain platform. The platform will aim to help businesses around the US and Latin America with liquidity solutions and cashflow management. Without disclosing details, the tech startups said in a statement that the deal forms a B2B fintech unicorn.

305.title: ICMR lab in Pune conducts 100 sample tests for monkeypox amid outbreak
305.article_body: Amid rising cases of monkeypox in India, Indian Council of Medical Research's (ICMR) Viral Research and Diagnostic Laboratories (VRDL) in Pune has conducted 100 tests for the outbreak till Wednesday morning. "We don't have any samples pending for testing as of now. Sample testing is a continuous process and it is being processed," a senior scientist at ICMR-NIV said.

306.title: DNA test gets UP man arrested for raping minor girl 28 years ago
306.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh was arrested 28 years after he and his brother allegedly raped a minor girl when his DNA matched with the boy born as a result of the crime, police said. Superintendent of Police Sanjay Kumar said a 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped by the two accused in 1994. The accused's brother is still absconding.

307.title: Cyberattack on Spanish research body likely originated from Russia: Govt
307.article_body: Spain's Science Ministry said the country's leading scientific research body was targeted by a cyberattack that authorities suspect had its origin in Russia. It appears no sensitive or confidential information was extracted, as per a preliminary analysis by cybersecurity authorities. The attack was similar to others carried out against NASA and Germany's Max Planck Institute, the Ministry said.

308.title: Twid raises $12 mn in Series A round to focus on tech, recruitment
308.article_body: Twid, a reward point-based payment platform, announced that it has secured $12 million in a Series A funding round. The round, led by Rakuten Capital, was joined by Google, ICMG Partners, Reddy Futures Fund and existing investors. The Fintech platform, founded in 2020, said it will use the capital to build tech capabilities, recruit people and expand product roll-outs.

309.title: 1.29 crore votes cast for NOTA in last 5 years: Poll rights body
309.article_body: About 1.29 crore votes were cast for NOTA (None of the above) option in the last five years in various elections, Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) said. On average, NOTA secured 64.53 lakh votes in state Assembly elections, according to the ADR report. Among NOTA votes in Lok Sabha polls, the highest number was in Bihar's Gopalganj (SC) at 51,660.

310.title: Bengaluru's Lalbagh flower show opens tomorrow
310.article_body: Bengaluru's Lalbagh Botanical Garden's annual flower show will open on Friday with officials expecting a footfall of 10-15 lakh people over the next 10 days. The show is taking place after a gap of two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic and this year's theme is based on Kannada film stars Dr Rajkumar and his son Puneeth Rajkumar.

311.title: Nayanthara texted, 'Best of luck & rooting for you': Janhvi on 'Good...'
311.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she asked for Nayanthara's number after the latter praised Janhvi and the trailer of 'Good Luck Jerry'. "I messaged her and said 'thank you...it means a lot to me'," she said. Janhvi added, "She actually replied which was very exciting to me and she said...'best of luck and rooting for you'."

312.title: It was Kohli's call purely, he decided he doesn't want to captain: BCCI Treasurer Dhumal
312.article_body: BCCI Treasurer Arun Dhumal, in an interview with veteran sports journalist Vimal Kumar, said that it was Virat Kohli's call "purely" to leave captaincy. "He decided that he doesn't want to captain India anymore...We respected his decision," Dhumal added. "We want that he returns to form soon," he further said.

313.title: USFDA flags quality, procedural lapses at Biocon's Hyderabad facility
313.article_body: United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) had flagged quality control and procedural lapses at Biocon's Hyderabad facility in a pre-approval inspection on July 20. "Three observations were cited...which we'll be addressing within the stipulated time," Biocon had said. The observations include deficient lab control mechanisms and failure to control critical storage parameters, etc.

314.title: For people in the cinema, theatres are our temples: Actor Prabhas
314.article_body: Actor Prabhas, while promoting Dulquer Salmaan's 'Sita Ramam', has said some films are meant to be watched in theatres. "The budget which the producers spent and the scale [on 'Sita Ramam'] is huge. For example, do we stop going to the temple because there's a pooja room at home? For people in the cinema, theatres are our temples," he added.

315.title: Present-day cricket is a topical point, it has become an issue: Smith
315.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith said present-day cricket is a topical point and has become an issue that needs to be looked at. "Talking of bilateral cricket...it's becoming packed now. Look at the next seven years, you have seven world events, the calendars are getting tight and it's not easy to figure this all out," added Smith.

316.title: Bookie arrested for taking bets on India-West Indies T20I match in Pune
316.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested an alleged bookie for taking bets on T20I cricket match between India and West Indies. Vinayak Shelar, 50, was arrested after police raided a flat in Pune's Mohan Nagar area following a tip-off. Six cell phones and an internet router were seized from Shelar. Police said they've launched a probe into a suspected cricket betting racket.

317.title: Son gives phone without SIM to mother; abandons her at temple in K'taka
317.article_body: A son abandoned his 80-year-old mother at a temple after giving her a mobile phone without a SIM card in Karnataka's Koppal district, police said. The man also gave her a sheet of paper saying that he has written his mobile phone number on it but purportedly it was an empty sheet of paper, police added.

318.title: 5 girls beat 13-yr-old outside school in Delhi, post video on Insta
318.article_body: A 13-year-old school student in Delhi was allegedly dragged and beaten up by a group of her seniors outside her school, the police said on Thursday. The incident took place on Wednesday and the students posted a video of the incident on Instagram, which shows the minor being dragged by her hair and thrashed by four to six girls.

319.title: Took up projects I didn't like only to run my kitchen: Annu Kapoor
319.article_body: Actor Annu Kapoor said at times he had to take up projects for money even though he didn't like the content. Annu said he feels "frustrated" from inside but can't do anything about it, adding, "I have to run the kitchen." "I'm not Amitabh Bachchan or Shah Rukh Khan or Salman Khan, I'm just a very small...struggling actor," he added.

320.title: No line, length or pace can keep Suryakumar Yadav quiet: Manjrekar
320.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted that Indian cricketer Suryakumar Yadav's growth as a batter in the last five years has been "phenomenal". "Few years back flick over square leg was his one 'go to' shot. Now, he has several," added Manjrekar. "There isn't a length or line or certain pace that can keep him quiet," he stated.

321.title: ‘Modishahi’ reaching new lows: Cong’s Jairam on ED summon to Kharge
321.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday reacted to the ED summon sent to party leader Mallikarjun Kharge. "Mallikarjun Kharge, Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha, was summoned by the ED when Parliament [was] in session. He, of course, left around 12:20 pm and presented himself. This is Modishahi reaching new lows," Ramesh tweeted.

322.title: Didn't think Bhuvneshwar has an int'l career 18 months back: Manjrekar
322.article_body: Talking about Bhuvneshwar Kumar, ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said, "18 months back, we thought he may not have an international career." Manjrekar added Bhuvneshwar has bounced back superbly and is certain to be a part of the T20 World Cup 2022 squad. "India keep going back to Bhuvneshwar...If you compare Bhuvneshwar and Arshdeep Singh, [the latter's]...much better," Manjrekar had stated.

323.title: GST imposed on 'Sarais' reminds of 'jizya tax' during Mughal rule: AAP MP
323.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha met Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday and demanded removal of 12% GST on 'Sarais' (inns) meant for devotees visiting Golden Temple in Amritsar, Punjab. Chadha said that tax on 'Sarais' reminds us of 'jizya tax' imposed during the Mughal era. "I have also demanded a financial package for Punjab," he added.

324.title: Ghosal breaks down after winning historic CWG medal for India by defeating best friend
324.article_body: Saurav Ghosal broke down after becoming the first Indian squash player to win a singles' medal in CWG history. The 35-year-old defeated his best friend James Willstrop of England in the bronze medal match. A video surfaced online showing Ghosal breaking down as the crowd applauded him for his win. India have bagged 18 medals at CWG 2022 so far.

325.title: Chandigarh-bound Go First flight diverted to Ahmedabad after bird hit
325.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has informed that the Go First flight G8911 operating today from Ahmedabad to Chandigarh was diverted back to Ahmedabad due to a bird hit. It comes a day after a car belonging to Go First airline went under an IndiGo aircraft at the Delhi airport, narrowly avoiding collision with the plane's nose wheel.

326.title: India win more medals in weightlifting at CWG 2022 than any other country
326.article_body: India clinched more medals in weightlifting at CWG 2022 than any other participating nation/territory. India ended their weightlifting campaign at CWG 2022 with a total of 10 medals, including three gold, three silver and four bronze medals. Canada bagged a total of eight weightlifting medals, while England won five medals.

327.title: China fires multiple missiles around Taiwan
327.article_body: China fired multiple missiles around Taiwan on Thursday as it launched its largest-ever military exercises a day after a visit by US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Taiwan's Defence Ministry said several Dongfeng missiles had been fired in waters to the northeast and southwest of the island. The last time China fired missiles into waters around Taiwan was in 1996.

328.title: Mumbai court extends ED custody of Sanjay Raut till August 8
328.article_body: A Mumbai court extended Enforcement Directorate (ED) custody of Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut till August 8. The MP, arrested in Patra Chawl money-laundering case, was produced before a special court today after his ED custody (as directed by PMLA court) ended. The court said that ED has made "remarkable progress" in the investigation and some aspects require further investigation.

329.title: We're stuck at place where we're trolled irrespective of body type: Kriti
329.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has said that she does not pay attention to trolls who body-shame her. "We are still stuck at a place where we're trolled irrespective of the body type we have," she said. Kriti, however, added that people need to block out such trolls as they can't keep getting affected by strangers passing comments.

330.title: B'luru Police posts video of flooded roads, asks BBMP to repair urgently
330.article_body: Traffic police of Bengaluru's Pulakeshinagar shared a video of flooded roads in CV Raman Nagar due to water logging and asked BBMP to take quick action on it. Taking to Twitter, the traffic police wrote, "Hello sir, in BBMP Ward No-79...drainage is blocked...This often causes water logging and traffic problems. Therefore drainage repair work should be done urgently sir."

331.title: 5 people arrested in Hyderabad for conspiring to kill realtor
331.article_body: Hyderabad's Pahadishareef police on Tuesday arrested five people for allegedly conspiring to kill a realtor. According to police, a realtor, identified as Farhan, had property issues with the sister of main accused Hussain Awalgi, who then hatched a conspiracy with four others to kill him. Two knives, sickles and mobile phones were also recovered from the apprehended persons, police said.

332.title: Tiger Global sells over 18 crore shares of Zomato; cuts stake by almost half
332.article_body: Tiger Global's Singapore-based Internet Fund VI sold off nearly half of its shareholding in food delivery firm Zomato, the hedge fund company disclosed in a filing with stock exchanges. It stated that it effectively sold over 18 crore shares, with its shareholding in Zomato now reduced to 2.77%. Earlier, Uber reportedly sold its 7.8% stake in Zomato for $392 million.

333.title: Govt lists steps on correct way to fold the National Flag
333.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, the government has listed steps on the correct way to fold the National Flag. The flag should be placed horizontally, following which the saffron and green bands should be folded under the middle white band. After the process is complete, the flag should be carried in arms or palms to store it.

334.title: My 8 hrs are equal to 15 hrs of others: Akshay on 'lacks commitment' claims
334.article_body: Reacting to the claims that he lacked commitment in films, actor Akshay Kumar has said, "I spend only eight hours on a film set in a day...I don't spend a single minute...in a vanity van." He added, "My eight hours are equal to 14-15 hours of any other star." These claims emerged after the failure of his film 'Samrat Prithviraj'.

335.title: Mumbai Police seizes over 700 kg of banned drug worth ₹1,400 cr; 5 held
335.article_body: The Anti Narcotics Cell of Mumbai Police's crime branch seized over 700 kilograms of banned drug mephedrone worth ₹1,400 crore at a drug manufacturing unit in Palghar's Nalasopara. As many as five persons were arrested in connection with the case, an official said. This is one of the biggest drug hauls by Mumbai Police in recent times, the official added.

336.title: What are some of SC's key judgments which India's next Chief Justice UU Lalit was part of?
336.article_body: Justice UU Lalit was part of the ruling which held 'triple talaq' unconstitutional. A bench he headed reversed a Bombay HC judgment, ruling that physical contact with minors with sexual intent will be an offence even without "skin-to-skin" contact. Justice Lalit led a bench that ruled the erstwhile royal family of Travancore has the management right over Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple.

337.title: We are 'not struggling' against left-arm pacers: Rohit Sharma
337.article_body: Rohit Sharma said he doesn't believe facing left-arm pacers is a weakness for his team, following West Indies pacer Obed McCoy's six-wicket haul in the second T20I. "It happens when you're trying to score quickly," added Rohit. Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain earlier said India should play left-arm pacers better. "Shaheen Shah Afridi blew them away...in Dubai," he had stated.

338.title: Not afraid of PM Modi, will not be intimidated: Rahul on ED action
338.article_body: A day after ED sealed Congress-owned National Herald office, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said, "We'll not be intimidated." "We're not afraid of [PM] Narendra Modi…Will continue to work to protect the country, democracy and help maintain harmony…Will do my work whatever they may do," he added. "They can put up more barricades. Truth can't be barricaded," Gandhi stated.

339.title: Investigating US' claim of killing al-Qaeda chief: Taliban
339.article_body: The Taliban has said it is investigating US' claim that al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri was killed in a US drone strike in Kabul. Suhail Shaheen, the designated Taliban representative to the United Nations, added that results of the investigation would be shared publicly. Taliban leaders have not confirmed the presence or death of Zawahiri in Kabul.

340.title: Mumbai's bus conductor, out on bail, molests minor again
340.article_body: The Mumbai Police is searching for a 34-year-old man for allegedly molesting a 16-year-old girl, who is his neighbour, days after he came out on bail after being arrested for the same offence in June this year. The accused, who works as a bus conductor for BEST in Mumbai, has been booked under the POCSO Act for the second time.

341.title: UP govt employee seeks 3-day leave to 'resolve fight with wife'; letter goes viral
341.article_body: A leave application written by a government employee in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur is going viral after he sought for three days' leave to resolve fight with his wife. "There has been an argument with my wife regarding love," he stated in the letter, adding that she has gone to her mother's house with their elder daughter and her two children.

342.title: Arshdeep is a future world no. 1, will be picked for T20 WC: Srikkanth
342.article_body: Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth said Team India pacer Arshdeep Singh will be the world number one in T20Is in the future, adding he will be picked for the T20 World Cup 2022. "He is simply outstanding...Make a note of it," stated Srikkanth. Arshdeep is India's leading wicket-taker in the ongoing T20I series against West Indies.

343.title: No shortage of foodgrain in country: Union Agriculture Minister
343.article_body: Union Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar informed the Parliament that there is no shortage of foodgrain in the country and stocks are sufficient to meet the demand. There are adequate stocks in the “central pool”, he added. "As on July 1, 2022, the actual stock of wheat is 285.10 LMT against the buffer norm of 275.80 LMT," Tomar said.

344.title: Former Haryana Congress leader Kuldeep Bishnoi joins BJP
344.article_body: Former Haryana Congress leader Kuldeep Bishnoi joined the BJP on Thursday at the party headquarters in Delhi, a day after he resigned as MLA from Adampur. He was inducted into BJP in the presence of Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar. Bishnoi was expelled by Congress from all party positions for cross-voting in the Rajya Sabha polls on June 10.

345.title: Want to do a dysfunctional family drama with Arjun: Janhvi Kapoor
345.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor, on being asked about the type of film she would like to work on with brother Arjun Kapoor, said it should be a "dysfunctional family drama with humour". "I feel there should be a road trip...[It] should...be like we didn't know we were related and we bump into each other. Then we realise we're brother-sister," Janhvi added.

346.title: Berlin-based Zalando's operating profit falls 58% due to inflation
346.article_body: Zalando, a German online fashion retailer on Thursday, reported a 58% fall in operating profit for the second quarter as against the corresponding period last year. Zalando said that it is expecting to return to growth and improve profitability in the second half of the year. It attributed the fall to lower consumer confidence, inflation and supply bottlenecks hitting demand.

347.title: Mannat was 1st offered to me, dad said 'What'll you do in such big house': Salman
347.article_body: Actor Salman Khan, in a recent interview, has revealed that actor Shah Rukh Khan's Mumbai home Mannat was first offered to him at the start of his career. He added, "My dad (Salim Khan) said, 'What will you do in such a big house?'" Salman said he wants to ask SRK what does he do in such a "big house".

348.title: The Wadhwa Group presents 3 & 4 BHK villas at Passcode Greencard, Panvel
348.article_body: The Wadhwa Group offers 3 and 4 BHK Nature Villas at Passcode Greencard in Panvel starting from Rs. 1.99 Cr*. Each villa comes with its own garden, patio, exclusive clubhouse, and private parking amidst 16 acres of greenery with 15+ lifestyle amenities. According to the brand, the concept of nature villas comes from the location's serene surroundings and lush views.

349.title: 8,000 gelatin sticks found abandoned in Kerala’s Palakkad, probe on
