349.article_body: Police in Kerala have launched an investigation after a large number of explosives were found abandoned near a quarry in Shornur, Palakkad district on Thursday. The seized explosives include 8,000 gelatin sticks stacked in 40 boxes. Police said they were informed about the explosives by locals and it's suspected that they were to be used for breaking rocks in quarries.

350.title: Is it suitable for ED to summon me amid ongoing session?: Kharge in RS
350.article_body: Addressing the Rajya Sabha, Congress MP Mallikarjun Kharge said, "Is it suitable for ED to summon me while the Parliament session is ongoing?" This was being done to demoralise the Opposition, he added. His statement comes after ED issued summons to Kharge asking him to be present at Herald House when it carries out searches as part of its probe.

351.title: Jaipur Police questions TV news anchor over misleading clips on Rahul Gandhi
351.article_body: Jaipur Police on Wednesday questioned TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan over misleading clips on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi that were aired on his show in July. Ranjan was sent a notice two days earlier to join the investigation in Jaipur. The show had linked Gandhi's remarks on vandalism at his office in Kerala's Wayanad to Udaipur's tailor murder case.

352.title: Don't react to negativity, it's only in words & air: Kartik Aaryan
352.article_body: During an interview, a fan asked Kartik Aaryan how it feels when people indirectly say something against him which can create a lot of misconceptions about him and how he wants his fans to react. To this, he replied, "I'd like to tell my fans to not react...Just don't ever react to negativity...it's only in words and...only in the air."

353.title: Pak don't have his replacement: Aaqib on Malik being dropped for Asia Cup
353.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said Pakistan don't have a replacement for Shoaib Malik who hasn't been picked in the nation's Asia Cup 2022 squad. "He perfectly fits at the number four spot," added Aaqib. Malik is the first-ever player from Asia to score 10,000 runs in T20 cricket. "Iftikhar Ahmad...has not made an impact while...Asif Ali is one-dimensional," stated Aaqib.

354.title: Hopefully by Budget session: Vaishnaw on data protection bill passage
354.article_body: After the government withdrew the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019 from the Lok Sabha on Wednesday, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said, "Hopefully by the Budget session we should be able to get the new law passed". The Bill was introduced on December 11, 2019 and was intended to provide for a law for the protection of personal data.

355.title: Vodafone Idea narrows Q1 loss to ₹7,296.7 crore, share price falls
355.article_body: Vodafone Idea Limited on Wednesday reported a marginal narrowing of its consolidated loss to ₹7,296.7 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹7,319.1 crore in the year-ago period. The telco's share price fell over 4% to ₹8.71 apiece on the BSE on Thursday. The company also announced that Ravinder Takkar will take over as its Chairman on August 19.

356.title: Man arrested for raping 13-yr-old daughter after she delivers his baby in Tamil Nadu
356.article_body: A 41-year-old man in Tamil Nadu's Vellore has been arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating his 13-year-old daughter. Police said the Class VIII girl was admitted to a hospital where she delivered a baby boy and told the hospital authorities that her father had been sexually abusing her since last year. The accused and his wife separated eight years ago.

357.title: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
357.article_body: The IMD has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in ghat areas of Tamil Nadu and over coastal and south interior Karnataka between August 4 and 5. Meanwhile very heavy rainfall has been predicted in isolated areas of Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala, Puducherry, Telangana, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Goa and east Rajasthan between August 4 and 7.

358.title: 9 Indian-origin men on most violent gangster list of Canada Police; details released
358.article_body: Police in Canada have issued a public warning identifying 11 men, including nine of Indian origin, linked to extreme levels of gang violence. They are Shakiel Basra (28), Amarpreet Samra (28), Jagdeep Cheema (30), Ravinder Samra (35), Barinder Dhaliwal (39), Andy Pierre (40), Gurpreet Dhaliwal (35), Richard Joseph Whitlock (40), Samroop Gill (29), Sukhdeep Pansal (33) and Sumdish Gill (28).

359.title: Don't decide on Shinde camp's claim to be real Shiv Sena now: SC directs EC
359.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed Election Commission to not decide on Eknath Shinde camp's claim to be the real Shiv Sena as of now. The EC had fixed August 8 to hear claim of Eknath Shinde faction. EC can't decide who's real Sena until there's a decision on disqualification pleas, Kapil Sibal, appearing for Uddhav Thackeray faction, told court.

360.title: Berlin considers U-turn on nuclear power phaseout amid energy crisis
360.article_body: Germany has said that extending lifetime of country's remaining nuclear power plants might make sense. Germany switched off three out of six of its power plants in the end of 2021 and aimed to shut the remaining three at the end of 2022. However, the plan is under reconsideration after Russia reduced gas deliveries to Berlin for supporting Ukraine.

361.title: Suspected drones fly over Taiwan, Defence Ministry reports cyber attacks
361.article_body: After US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi concluded her Taiwan trip, unidentified aircraft, probably drones, flew above the area of Taiwan's outlying Kinmen islands near the mainland coast. Authorities also reported that hackers attacked the website of Defence Ministry. Meanwhile, China has launched its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan.

362.title: Kerala HC seeks NTA's reply over standard exam protocol across India
362.article_body: Kerala High Court has sought a response from the National Testing Agency (NTA) to a plea seeking a standard protocol for conducting examinations across India. This comes after some girls were forced to remove bras at a NEET exam centre in Kerala's Kollam. The plea has also sought directions to NTA to permit the girls to re-appear for the exam.

363.title: People expect star kids to be perfectionists: Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth
363.article_body: Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa said the notion that celebrity kids have an easier time in the entertainment industry is a misconception. "It's difficult since we need to prove ourselves...without making any mistakes. People anticipate us to be perfectionists," Aishwaryaa added. She said that as compared to star kids, it's rather easy for newcomers to make errors and get away with them.

364.title: Have never given wife Twinkle chance to fear anything I do: Akshay Kumar
364.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has said that he has never given his wife Twinkle Khanna a chance to fear anything he does. "My core belief has always been about catering to the family. Rarely have my films got an 'A' certificate from the censor board," he added. Akshay further stated he does "homely, family-oriented" films.

365.title: Joaquin Phoenix's 'Joker 2' set to release on October 4, 2024
365.article_body: A spokesperson of Warner Bros on Wednesday said Joaquin Phoenix-starrer 'Joker: Folie a Deux' will release on October 4, 2024. The film is a sequel to the 2019 film 'Joker'. Joaquin won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his role. Filmmaker Todd Phillips, who earned Academy Award nomination for Best Director for the 2019 film, will direct the sequel.

366.title: Think about Suryakumar, would you be happy opening?: Srikkanth to Kaif
366.article_body: Talking about batter Suryakumar Yadav opening in the T20Is against West Indies, ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth asked former India batter Mohammad Kaif, "If I ask you to open...would you like it?" Kaif responded with a ''no''. "Same with Suryakumar. Think about him," stated Srikkanth. "Suryakumar...should be batting at number four...Don't spoil the cricketer," he said.

367.title: Attacks on Sikhs in Afghanistan is attack on identity of being Sikh: Harbhajan in RS
367.article_body: AAP Rajya Sabha MP Harbhajan Singh raised the issue of "attacks on Sikhs and gurdwaras in Afghanistan" on Wednesday in Rajya Sabha. "This is not only a matter which has hurt the sentiments of Sikhs living across the world...it is also an attack on the identity of being a Sikh," he added. "Why such attacks on us only?" he asked.

368.title: Campaign against Agnipath scheme from August 7: Rakesh Tikait
368.article_body: Speaking in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat at a farmers' congregation, Bhartiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait said that his farmers' group will start a campaign against the Centre's Agnipath military recruitment scheme from August 7. "It will continue for over a week," he added. "The fight with the Centre and UP government over the issue was yet to begin," Tikait stated.

369.title: US House Speaker meets leaders in S Korea, discusses security, climate
369.article_body: After concluding her Taiwan trip, US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi headed to South Korea where she met top political leaders on Thursday. Pelosi met South Korean National Assembly Speaker Kim Jin-pyo and other leaders to discuss economic cooperation, regional security and climate change. Pelosi will reportedly visit an inter-Korean border area controlled by US-led UN Command and North Korea.

370.title: Russia accuses Azerbaijan of ceasefire violation in Karabakh conflict
370.article_body: Russia accused Azerbaijan of ceasefire violation in disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh. On Wednesday, Azeri defence ministry accused Armenia of committing sabotage act. Meanwhile, Armenia called upon international community to help stop Azerbaijan's "aggressive actions". As tensions flared up in disputed region, three soldiers were killed. EU has called for "immediate cessation of hostilities".

371.title: CJI NV Ramana recommends Justice UU Lalit's name as his successor
371.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana has recommended Justice Uday Umesh Lalit's name as his successor. Justice Lalit will become the 49th CJI. Justice Lalit, who enrolled as an Advocate in June 1983, practised in the High Court of Bombay till December 1985 and was appointed Judge of the Supreme Court of India in August 2014.

372.title: Who won medals for India on Day 6 of CWG 2022?
372.article_body: India won five medals on Day 6 of CWG 2022, taking their medal tally to 18. Indian weightlifters Lovepreet Singh and Gurdeep Singh bagged bronze in men’s 109 kg and 109+ kg categories, respectively. Saurav Ghosal bagged bronze in men’s singles squash event, while judoka Tulika Maan clinched silver. Further, high jumper Tejaswin Shankar won India a bronze medal.

373.title: India beat Barbados by 100 runs, reach women's cricket semi-finals at CWG 2022
373.article_body: India defeated Barbados by 100 runs in their last group match of women's T20I cricket event at CWG 2022. With the victory, India advanced to the semi-finals of the tournament. India put up a total of 162/4 before restricting Barbados to 62/8 in their 20 overs. Renuka Singh registered figures of 4-0-10-4.

374.title: Tina Dabi shares Jaisalmer pics after Rajasthan gets highest rainfall in July in 66 years
374.article_body: IAS officer Tina Dabi shared photos of Rajasthan's Jaisalmer after the state received 270 mm of rainfall in July, the highest in 66 years. The Jaisalmer Collector wrote, "Who would believe this is a desert? Jaisalmer in monsoon!" She added, "This is how beautiful the various parts of the district are looking after receiving record-breaking rainfall in the last month."

375.title: 'Flood tourism' will not be permitted: Kerala minister amid rains
375.article_body: Amid rains in Kerala, state minister K Rajan on Wednesday said that people should strictly avoid going to areas which are inundated or flooded as part of a growing trend of “flood tourism”. He warned that such activities will not be permitted and police would be used to remove such persons.

376.title: CNG price increases by ₹6 per kg in Pune; 7th hike since April
376.article_body: The price of compressed natural gas (CNG) has been increased by ₹6 in Pune, effective from Thursday. CNG will now cost ₹91 per kg in Pune. This is the seventh price hike since April this year. "Overall, there is a shortage of CNG as there is no supply from Russia and Ukraine," All India Petroleum Dealers Association spokesperson said.

377.title: Delhi govt plans to introduce app-based premium bus service
377.article_body: Delhi government has revived its plan to introduce mobile application-based AC bus service to encourage office-goers to use public transport, officials said. Delhi government first approved this scheme in 2016 which got struck down by the then Lieutenant Governor for not taking his approval. It worked on the plan again in 2017-2018, but it fizzled out due to permit issues.

378.title: Manipur man arrested for murdering childhood friend in Hyderabad
378.article_body: Hyderabad police on Wednesday arrested a 21-year-old man from Manipur for allegedly killing his childhood friend. According to police, the accused, P Namasudra, and victim, Dipendu Biswas, were residents of Tukaramgate in Hyderabad. Biswas had reportedly developed intimacy with Namasudra's wife following which the latter decided to kill him. The incident took place on July 25, police added.

379.title: Russian man marries Ukrainian girlfriend in Dharamshala as per Indian traditions
379.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, a Russian man named Sergei Novikov recently married his Ukrainian girlfriend Elona Bramoka in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala as per Indian traditions. The couple could be seen in traditional Indian outfits during the wedding ceremony. "Our pandit Raman Sharma solemnised their marriage...as per the traditions of the Sanatan Dharma," Divya Ashram Kharota's official said.

380.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 5 medals in a day?
380.article_body: India bagged five medals on Day 6 of CWG 2022, including one silver and four bronze medals. India are currently seventh on the medal standings with a total of five gold medals. Australia lead the standings with 46 gold medals. Meanwhile, England have become the second nation after Australia to bag more than 100 medals at CWG 2022.

381.title: He's impressed everyone with his calmness: PM Modi on Lovepreet's bronze
381.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to congratulate weightlifter Lovepreet Singh, who won a bronze medal at CWG 2022, breaking his own national record. "Lovepreet has impressed everyone with his calm temperament and dedication," he tweeted. PM Modi further termed him as "talented" and "dynamic" in his tweet. Lovepreet lifted a total of 355 kg in the men's 109-kg final.

382.title: Famous actor Mithilesh Chaturvedi passes away
382.article_body: Famous actor Mithilesh Chaturvedi has passed away. The actor reportedly breathed his last in Lucknow after suffering a cardiac ailment. The actor is known for being a part of multiple films and shows such as Gadar: Ek Prem Katha, Koi... Mil Gaya, My Friend Pinto, Phata Poster Nikla Hero and Ready amongst others.

383.title: 2 Sri Lankan athletes, 1 manager go missing at Commonwealth Games in UK
383.article_body: Three members of Sri Lanka's contingent at the Commonwealth Games in UK have disappeared. A judoka, a wrestler and the judo manager went missing. "We've asked all athletes and officials to submit their passports to our respective venue officials after the incident. The police is investigating and the three cannot cross the UK borders," said Sri Lankan team press attache.

384.title: It's 'very terrifying': Amitabh Bachchan on hosting seasons of KBC
384.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, while talking about hosting 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' year after year, said he feels nervous every time he goes on the sets. "It's bhayankar (very terrifying). My hands and legs shake when I come on...set," Amitabh added. He further said that it's the audience that keeps him motivated, adding, "It's because of them that we are here."

385.title: She was very concerned: Tulika's mother on her considering leaving judo
385.article_body: Judoka Tulika Maan, who won a silver medal at CWG 2022, had contemplated quitting judo a few months back after not being named in the initial squad, terming the selection criteria "wrong" in an email. "It was...very difficult...She was very concerned about how things would pan out," said Tulika's mother Amrita Maan. "I couldn't show...I was upset," she added.

386.title: Quite bold of him: Aamir Khan on Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot
386.article_body: During his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', actor Aamir Khan reacted to actor Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot. "He's got a great physique. I thought it was quite bold of him," Aamir said. This comes after Karan Johar had asked Kareena Kapoor which Instagram account will she visit to watch "thirsty photos". To this, Kareena named Ranveer Singh.

387.title: Suspended DCP Parag Manere reinstated by Maha CM Eknath Shinde-led govt
387.article_body: DCP Parag Manere, who was suspended by Uddhav Thackeray-led Maharashtra government, in an extortion case related to Param Bir Singh has been reinstated by Eknath Shinde-led government. Manere was suspended after the case was filed against Singh in which he was also an accused. Manere and others had allegedly demanded ₹2 crore from the complainant and forcibly acquired his land.

388.title: Was overconfident, thought people will come to see my 1st film: Janhvi on 'Dhadak'
388.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she was "very unaware" during the release of her debut film 'Dhadak'. "It was the naiveness but there was also the overconfidence that 'people will definitely come to watch my first film to see how I am'," she added. The film, which also featured Ishaan Khatter, earned over ₹110 crore at the worldwide box office.

389.title: Elon Musk's answer to Twitter lawsuit to be made public by Friday
389.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's response to Twitter's lawsuit over his abandoned $44 billion buyout deal will be made public latest by Friday evening, a judge said. Musk's attorneys wanted to file the public version of their response on Wednesday, however, Twitter attorneys needed more time. "Few cases attract as much public interest as this one," the Twitter attorney wrote.

390.title: Happy that I could 'turn my coat': Supriyo on trolls calling him 'turncoat'
390.article_body: TMC's Babul Supriyo, who got inducted into Mamata Banerjee's cabinet on Wednesday, responded to trolls who called him a "turncoat" and said, "I am extremely happy I could show courage to 'Turn my Coat' on a party who unfairly tried to make me a 'Scape Goat'." "Half of your state governments are with 'poached' MLA's from other parties," he added.

391.title: Traffic to be hit on some routes of Mumbai due to VVIP visit
391.article_body: Traffic movement is expected to be slow on Eastern Freeway and Western Expressway on Thursday due to scheduled VVIP visit, the Mumbai Traffic Police said. The traffic will be slow from 9 am to 2 pm between NCPA to Vashi on Eastern Freeway and between 3 pm to 8 pm between NCPA to Dindoshi on Western Expressway, the police said.

392.title: Delhi reports India's 1st monkeypox case in a woman, city's count reaches 4
392.article_body: A Nigerian woman, living in Delhi for over a month, on Wednesday tested positive for monkeypox. This is the first confirmed monkeypox case in a woman in India. The number of confirmed monkeypox cases in Delhi has reached four and India's total tally has reached nine. Notably, the woman had no history of international travel in the last 21 days.

393.title: US Senate approves Sweden & Finland's bid to join NATO amid Ukraine war
393.article_body: US Senate has ratified the entry of Sweden and Finland into NATO amid Russia's war in Ukraine. Senate voted 95 to 1 in favour of the two countries' accession. "This historic vote sends an important signal of...sustained, bipartisan US commitment to NATO, and to ensuring our alliance is prepared to meet...challenges of today and tomorrow," US President Joe Biden said.

394.title: More special than gold: Anurag Thakur on Tejaswin's historic bronze
394.article_body: Reacting to Indian high jumper Tejaswin Shankar scripting history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win a medal in high jump at CWG, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted, "This bronze is more special than a gold!!" Tejaswin won a bronze medal with a best jump of 2.22 metres. He helped India win its first medal in athletics at CWG 2022.

395.title: 'Grotesque greed': UN chief criticises oil and gas companies
395.article_body: United Nations (UN) chief Antonio Guterres on Wednesday criticised the oil and gas companies for making record profits from the energy crisis "on the backs of the poorest people and communities and at a massive cost to the climate". Guterres further said that their "grotesque greed" was destroying "our only...home". He also urged all governments to tax these profits.

396.title: China begins its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan
396.article_body: China has begun its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan despite China's warnings of consequences over it. Earlier, local news outlets reported that the Taiwanese Ministry of National Defense has begun to "immediately prepare for war" and has put the military on high alert.

397.title: My acting in 'A Thursday' left my house help terrified: Yami Gautam
397.article_body: Yami Gautam revealed that her house help was 'terrified' after watching her performance in 'A Thursday'. The woman reportedly told the actress that she broke a glass and hoped that she wouldn't treat her like the film. Yami added that she took it as a compliment and was happy that she managed to create such an impact through her performance.

398.title: India to have US-like roads by 2024: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari
398.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said government will construct 26 green express highways by 2024 and bring down travel time between key cities across India. "By 2024, I guarantee...roads in India will be like those in US," he added. Furthermore, he said, once highways are completed, travel time from Delhi to Dehradun, Haridwar and Jaipur will be reduced to two hours.

399.title: Winter COVID wave may have peaked early: Australian Health Minister
399.article_body: Australian Health Minister Mark Butler said on Thursday that the country may have reached the peak of the latest wave of COVID-19 outbreak earlier than expected. Australia witnessed winter outbreak due to the new Omicron sub-variant BA.4/5, putting strain on hospitals and retirement homes. However, hospitals have reported a steady fall in number of admissions over the past week.

400.title: Sensex jumps 334.22 points, Nifty above 17,479 in opening trade
400.article_body: Benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Thursday with Sensex and Nifty surging 334.22 points and 91.60 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 58,684.75 points and Nifty at 17,479.80. Hindalco Industries, Infosys, UltraTech Cement and IndusInd Bank were among the major Nifty gainers, while Tata Consumer Products, Britannia Industries, SBI Life Insurance, ONGC and Divis Labs slipped.

401.title: 7-yr-old boy makes Zomato deliveries on cycle till 11pm after father's accident
401.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video, showing a seven-year-old boy delivering orders for Zomato after his father, a Zomato delivery agent, met with an accident. The boy said that he goes to school in the morning and delivers orders from 6-11pm on a cycle. "Kindly share his father's details with us via a private message," Zomato replied on the post.
